definition.en: The plural of curriculum: the subjects or courses taught by a school, program, or teacher.
definition.zh: curriculum（课程设置/课程体系）的复数：学校、项目或教师所教授的科目与课程安排。

examples.en: Different schools have different curricula for math and science.
examples.zh: 不同学校在数学和科学方面有不同的课程设置。

examples.en: The new teacher compared the curricula used in the U.S. and China.
examples.zh: 新老师比较了美国和中国使用的课程体系。

extraExplanation: “Curriculum”源自拉丁语，原意接近“跑道/路线”，后来引申为“学习的路径”。因此curriculum/curricula常用来强调一个项目整体的学习规划，而不只是单一的一门课。
用法提示：在美式英语里，口语和一般写作中常用更规则的复数“curriculums”；但在教育、学术或较正式语境中，“curricula”更常见也更“书面”。

summary.en: Curricular means “connected with a school or course curriculum.”
summary.zh: curricular 意为“与学校或课程的课程体系有关的；课程的”。

definition.en: Related to a curriculum (the subjects and skills taught in a school or course).
definition.zh: 与课程体系（学校或课程中教授的科目与技能）有关的；课程的。

examples.en: The school made several curricular changes to add more computer science.
examples.zh: 学校做了一些课程方面的调整，加入更多计算机科学内容。

examples.en: Curricular activities include required classes like math and English.
examples.zh: 课程活动包括数学和英语等必修课。

extraExplanation: “Curricular”常见于教育语境，常与 change / reform / requirements / goals 等词搭配。

常见对比：
- curricular（课程内的、属于正式教学计划的）
- extracurricular（课外的、在正式课程之外的，如社团、运动队）
例：curricular activities（课程内活动） vs. extracurricular activities（课外活动）。
词源上来自拉丁语 curriculum（“跑道；进程”），引申为“学习进程/课程”。

summary.en: Curricularization is the process of making something an official part of a school or training curriculum.
summary.zh: Curricularization 指把某个内容正式纳入课程体系的“课程化”过程。

definition.en: the process of turning a topic, skill, or activity into part of an official curriculum (a planned course of study), often by creating learning goals, lessons, and assessments
definition.zh: 将某个主题、技能或活动纳入正式课程体系的过程（常通过设定学习目标、设计课程内容与评价方式来实现）

examples.en: The curricularization of digital literacy means students learn it systematically across grades, not just in optional workshops.
examples.zh: 将“数字素养”课程化，意味着学生会在不同年级系统学习，而不是只参加可选的工作坊。

examples.en: Teachers discussed the curricularization of local history through projects, readings, and exams.
examples.zh: 老师们讨论如何通过项目、阅读与考试把本地历史“课程化”。

extraExplanation: “curricularization”多见于教育政策、课程研究（curriculum studies）等学术或机构语境，日常英语里较少使用。更常见的表达包括“make it part of the curriculum / integrate it into the curriculum / embed it in the curriculum”。
构词法：curriculum（课程）+ -arize（使……化/使成为……）→ curricularize（使纳入课程）+ -ation（名词后缀，表示过程）→ curricularization（课程化的过程）。

summary.en: “Curricularize” means to make something part of the curriculum or turn it into teachable course content.
summary.zh: “curricularize”指把某内容纳入课程体系或将其课程化，使之成为可系统教授的课程内容。

definition.en: to make something part of a school/college curriculum; to organize or design content so it can be taught as a course or program
definition.zh: 把某事纳入课程体系；将内容课程化（使之适合以课程形式教学）

examples.en: The district wants to curricularize media literacy in middle school.
examples.zh: 学区希望在初中把媒介素养课程化（纳入正式课程）。

examples.en: They curricularized workplace safety training so every student would learn it systematically.
examples.zh: 他们把职场安全培训课程化，让每个学生都能系统学习。

extraExplanation: “curricularize”由 curriculum（课程）+ -ize（使……化）构成，常见于教育政策、课程改革与培训设计语境，日常英语中相对少见。更常见、自然的表达包括：add … to the curriculum（把……纳入课程）、build … into the curriculum（把……融入课程）、develop a curriculum for …（为……开发课程）。

summary.en: Curriculum means the overall plan of what a school or course teaches—subjects, skills, and learning goals.
summary.zh: Curriculum 指学校或课程教授什么的整体规划，包括科目、技能与学习目标。

definition.en: The subjects, skills, and learning goals that are taught in a school, course, or program; the overall plan of what students will learn.
definition.zh: 课程设置；课程体系：在学校、课程或项目中教授的科目、技能与学习目标的整体规划。

examples.en: The school updated its curriculum to include more computer science.
examples.zh: 学校更新了课程设置，把更多计算机科学内容纳入其中。

examples.en: This course has a heavy reading curriculum, so plan your time carefully.
examples.zh: 这门课的阅读任务很重，所以要合理安排时间。

examples.en: Parents asked how the curriculum teaches critical thinking.
examples.zh: 家长询问课程体系如何培养批判性思维。

definition.en: A list or outline of what will be studied in a particular class (similar to a syllabus, but often broader and longer-term).
definition.zh: （某一课程的）学习内容大纲/安排（类似 syllabus“教学大纲”，但常更偏长期、范围更广）。

examples.en: Our math curriculum covers algebra, geometry, and statistics.
examples.zh: 我们的数学课程安排涵盖代数、几何和统计。

examples.en: The teacher shared the curriculum at the start of the semester.
examples.zh: 老师在学期开始时分享了课程内容安排。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：curriculum 来自拉丁语，原意与“跑道/赛程（course）”有关，所以它常带有“学习旅程的路线图”的感觉。
用法区分：curriculum 通常指“整体课程体系/长期规划”；syllabus 更常指“某门课的详细教学大纲（每周安排、评分方式、作业等）”。
常见搭配：curriculum design（课程设计）、curriculum standards（课程标准）、core curriculum（核心课程）、curriculum vitae / CV（简历；注意这是固定搭配，和课程含义不同）。

summary.en: “Curriculums” means more than one curriculum—planned subjects, lessons, and learning goals in a school or program.
summary.zh: “Curriculums”表示不止一套课程体系，即学校或项目中规划的教学内容与学习目标。

definition.en: Plural of “curriculum”: the subjects and skills taught by a school, program, or course (the planned set of lessons and learning goals).
definition.zh: “curriculum”的复数：学校、培训项目或课程所教授的学科与技能（规划好的课程内容与学习目标）。

examples.en: Different schools design their curriculums to meet students’ needs.
examples.zh: 不同学校会设计各自的课程体系来满足学生的需求。

examples.en: The district updated its math curriculums this year.
examples.zh: 该学区今年更新了数学课程体系。

extraExplanation: “Curriculum”的常见复数有两种：curriculums 和 curricula。curricula 更偏正式、学术写作中更常见；curriculums 更口语、更常见于日常英语与美式写作中，两者都正确。
用法小提示：谈“某一门课的课程设置”常说 a curriculum（如 the curriculum for English）；谈“多套课程/多个项目”就用复数 curriculums/curricula。

summary.en: “Currie” is most commonly a surname; it can also be a Scottish place name near Edinburgh.
summary.zh: “Currie”最常见是姓氏；也可作地名（苏格兰爱丁堡附近的 Currie）。

definition.en: a family name (surname), especially common in English-speaking countries (often of Scottish origin)
definition.zh: 姓氏（家族名），在英语国家常见（常被认为有苏格兰渊源）

examples.en: Dr. Currie will see you now.
examples.zh: Currie 医生现在可以见你了。

examples.en: My teacher’s last name is Currie.
examples.zh: 我老师的姓是 Currie。

definition.en: a place name (e.g., Currie, a suburb/village near Edinburgh, Scotland)
definition.zh: 地名（例如苏格兰爱丁堡附近的 Currie 镇/郊区）

examples.en: She lives in Currie, just outside Edinburgh.
examples.zh: 她住在爱丁堡郊外的 Currie。

examples.en: We took a bus to Currie for a short hike.
examples.zh: 我们坐公交去 Currie 进行一次短途徒步。

extraExplanation: “Currie”常见作姓氏；如果你想找的是科学家“Marie Curie（玛丽·居里）”，注意她的姓拼写是 **Curie**，发音也更接近 /ˈkjʊri/（英式）或 /kjʊˈriː/（美式常见读法），与“Currie”不同。
作为苏格兰地名的 Currie 位于爱丁堡西南方向，日常英语里看到时多半是专有名词，需要大写。

summary.en: Currie is most commonly a surname, and it can also be a place name.
summary.zh: Currie 最常见作姓氏，也可作地名。

definition.en: a family name (surname), common in English-speaking countries.
definition.zh: 姓氏（英文常见姓）。

examples.en: My professor, Dr. Currie, specializes in public health.
examples.zh: 我的教授柯里博士专攻公共卫生。

examples.en: The email was signed “S. Currie.”
examples.zh: 这封邮件的署名是 “S. Currie”。

definition.en: a place name (used for some towns/areas, especially in Scotland and Australia).
definition.zh: 地名（一些地区/城镇的名称，尤见于苏格兰和澳大利亚）。

examples.en: They moved to Currie for a quieter lifestyle.
examples.zh: 他们搬到 Currie 去过更安静的生活。

examples.en: Currie is a suburb on the outskirts of Edinburgh.
examples.zh: Currie 是爱丁堡郊外的一个区域。

synonyms: (as a surname) no true synonyms; similar: family name, surname
extraExplanation: “Currie”常被学习者和“Curie（居里）”混淆：Curie 更常见，指玛丽·居里（Marie Curie）或放射性活度单位 curie（符号 Ci）。
“Currie”在发音上也容易和“curry（咖喱）”混：curry 是食物/动词；Currie 通常是人名或地名。

summary.en: Curried most often means food flavored or cooked with curry; it can also be the past form of “curry,” including the idiom “curry favor” (to flatter for approval).
summary.zh: curried 最常指“咖喱味的/用咖喱烹调的”；也可作动词 curry 的过去式/过去分词，并出现在习语 curry favor（讨好、巴结）中。

definition.en: (of food) cooked with curry spices or curry sauce; flavored with curry.
definition.zh: （食物）用咖喱香料或咖喱酱烹调的；有咖喱味的。

examples.en: We ordered curried chicken with rice.
examples.zh: 我们点了咖喱鸡配米饭。

examples.en: Curried lentil soup is warm, filling, and easy to make.
examples.zh: 咖喱扁豆汤暖胃、饱腹，也很容易做。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “curry”: to prepare or flavor food with curry.
definition.zh: “curry”的过去式/过去分词：给食物加入咖喱调味或用咖喱烹调。

examples.en: She curried the vegetables and served them with flatbread.
examples.zh: 她把蔬菜做成咖喱，配薄饼一起端上来。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “curry”: to groom a horse by rubbing or brushing its coat (less common today).
definition.zh: “curry”的过去式/过去分词：用刷具擦洗、梳理马的皮毛（较少见）。

examples.en: The stablehand curried the horse before the ride.
examples.zh: 马夫在骑乘前给马梳理皮毛。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle in the phrase “curry favor”: to try to gain someone’s approval by flattering them or doing extra things for them.
definition.zh: 用于短语“curry favor”：通过奉承或刻意讨好来获取某人的好感。

examples.en: He stayed late all week to curry favor with his manager.
examples.zh: 他整周都加班到很晚，想讨好经理。

examples.en: It’s better to do good work than to curry favor.
examples.zh: 与其讨好别人，不如把工作做好。

extraExplanation: “curried”最常见的是形容词，指“带咖喱味的”。英语里常见搭配有：curried chicken（咖喱鸡）、curried rice（咖喱饭）、curried lentils（咖喱扁豆）。
“curry favor”里的 curry 与“咖喱”无关。这个短语来源较早，含义是“讨好、巴结”，语气通常偏负面，暗示不够真诚。

summary.en: Currier most commonly means a person who finishes leather, and it is also a well-known surname (as in Currier & Ives).
summary.zh: Currier 常指“皮革整理工”，也可作姓氏（如版画公司 Currier & Ives）。

definition.en: a person whose job is to treat and finish leather (making it smooth, flexible, and ready to use)
definition.zh: （皮革）鞣制与整理工；皮革加工工人（使皮革更柔软、光滑并可使用）

examples.en: The currier softened the leather before it was cut into shoes.
examples.zh: 皮革整理工先把皮革处理得更柔软，再裁剪做鞋。

examples.en: In the past, curriers and tanners often worked in the same neighborhood.
examples.zh: 过去，皮匠（鞣皮工）和皮革整理工常在同一片区域工作。

definition.en: a surname; especially known from the American printmaking firm Currier & Ives
definition.zh: 姓氏；尤指美国版画公司“Currier & Ives（柯立尔与艾夫斯）”中的 Currier

examples.en: This print is in the style of Currier & Ives.
examples.zh: 这幅版画带有“柯立尔与艾夫斯”的风格。

examples.en: Nathaniel Currier helped popularize affordable prints in 19th-century America.
examples.zh: 内森尼尔·柯立尔推动了19世纪美国平价版画的流行。

extraExplanation: “Currier”常被初学者与“courier（快递员/信使）”混淆：拼写不同、读音也不同。courier 通常指递送文件或包裹的人；currier 则与皮革加工有关。
Currier & Ives 是19世纪美国著名的石版画出版商，以大众化的风景、节日、日常生活图像闻名；英语里常用 “in the style of Currier & Ives” 来形容具有复古美国版画风格的图像或装饰。

summary.en: Currier is usually a proper name (e.g., in “Currier and Ives”); in everyday delivery contexts, the word you likely want is courier.
summary.zh: Currier通常用作专名（如“Currier and Ives”）；日常表达“快递/信使”更可能要用courier。

definition.en: A person or company that delivers messages, documents, or packages (often quickly).
definition.zh: 快递员；快递公司（通常强调速度快）

examples.en: I sent the contract by courier to make sure it arrived today.
examples.zh: 我用快递把合同寄出，确保今天能到。

examples.en: A courier delivered the package to the front desk.
examples.zh: 一名快递员把包裹送到了前台。

definition.en: (Art/history) A printmaker or publisher, especially in the name “Currier and Ives.”
definition.zh: （艺术/历史）版画制作者或出版商（常见于“Currier and Ives/柯里尔与艾夫斯”之名）

examples.en: The museum has a Currier and Ives print of a winter sleigh ride.
examples.zh: 博物馆收藏了一幅“柯里尔与艾夫斯”的冬日雪橇版画。

extraExplanation: “courier（快递）”是现代常用词，发音是 /ˈkʊriər/。你输入的“currier”更常见的意思其实是“皮革鞣制工/皮革加工者”，但在当代英语里这个职业词很少见；很多时候“currier”是人名或品牌名。
“Currier and Ives”是19世纪美国很有名的版画出版组合（Nathaniel Currier 与 James Merritt Ives），他们的大量石版画描绘日常生活、风景与历史事件，因此在英语文化语境中常被当作“经典复古美国版画”的代表。

summary.en: Currieries are places where leather is finished and softened after tanning.
summary.zh: Currieries 指鞣制后对皮革进行软化、抛光等整理加工的场所（作坊/工厂）。

definition.en: plural of curriery: places (workshops or factories) where leather is curried—cleaned, softened, and finished after tanning.
definition.zh: curriery 的复数：指进行“鞣后整理/软化与抛光”等工序的皮革作坊或工厂（把皮革处理得更柔软、耐用、光滑）。

examples.en: In the 1800s, small currieries operated alongside tanneries near rivers.
examples.zh: 在19世纪，一些小型皮革整理作坊常与制革厂一起设在河边。

examples.en: The town once had several currieries that supplied finished leather to shoemakers.
examples.zh: 这个小镇曾有好几家皮革整理作坊，为制鞋匠提供成品皮革。

extraExplanation: “curriery”是比较少见、偏历史/行业用语的词。现代更常见的说法是“tannery（制革厂）”或“leather workshop / leather factory（皮革作坊/工厂）”。
词根与“currier（皮革整理工）”有关；这里的“curry”不是指咖喱食物，而是指对皮革进行梳理、涂油、软化等整理工序。

summary.en: “Curriers” means people who finish and treat leather (plural of “currier”).
summary.zh: “curriers”指制革匠、皮革精加工者（“currier”的复数）。

definition.en: (Plural) people whose job is to treat, dress, and finish leather (for example, making it smooth, soft, and ready to use).
definition.zh: （复数）制革匠；皮革加工者（负责处理、鞣制并整理皮革，使其柔软光滑、可用）。

examples.en: In the past, curriers worked near tanneries to finish leather for shoes and saddles.
examples.zh: 过去，制革匠常在制革厂附近工作，把皮革加工成可用于鞋子和马鞍的成品。

examples.en: The museum shows tools used by curriers to smooth and oil leather.
examples.zh: 博物馆展示了制革匠用来打磨并给皮革上油的工具。

extraExplanation: “curriers”是名词“currier”的复数。currier和tanner（鞣皮工）有关：tanner主要负责“鞣制”让皮革不易腐坏；currier更偏向后续“整理/抛光/上油/软化”等精加工。
注意不要和“couriers（快递员/信使）”混淆：发音和拼写都很像，但意思完全不同。
也容易让人想到动词“to curry”（如“curry favor”=讨好、巴结），那是另一个常见用法；但“currier(s)”指的是做皮革的工匠。

summary.en: Curriery means a workshop—or the trade—where leather is curried and finished after tanning.
summary.zh: Curriery 指制革后整理的作坊，或皮革后整理这一工序/行业。

definition.en: a place (workshop or factory) where leather is curried—cleaned, softened, and finished after tanning
definition.zh: 制革作坊；鞣革后进行“搓脂、软化与整理”等后处理的地方

examples.en: The old curriery by the river has been turned into a museum.
examples.zh: 河边那家旧制革作坊已经被改造成博物馆。

examples.en: After tanning, the hides were sent to a curriery for finishing.
examples.zh: 皮革鞣制完成后，被送到制革作坊做后整理。

definition.en: the business or process of currying and finishing leather
definition.zh: 皮革后整理（搓脂、软化、抛光等）的工序或行业

examples.en: He learned curriery from his uncle and later opened his own shop.
examples.zh: 他跟叔叔学做皮革后整理，后来开了自己的铺子。

examples.en: Curriery requires patience and skill to make leather smooth and durable.
examples.zh: 皮革后整理需要耐心与技巧，才能把皮子做得光滑耐用。

extraExplanation: “curriery”比较少见，多出现在历史语境（如老工坊、旧城行业）或专业制革资料中。
注意区分：tannery（鞣革厂）主要负责“鞣制”；curriery更偏向鞣制之后的“上油、揉软、整饰、抛光”等后期处理。
词形关联：currier（做皮革后整理的人）→ curriery（其作坊/行业）；与日常的curry（咖喱，或“奉承”）不是同一意思。

summary.en: “Curries” most often means multiple curry dishes; it can also be the verb form meaning “grooms a horse” or “tries to gain favor.”
summary.zh: “Curries”最常指多种咖喱菜；也可作动词，表示“给马梳毛”或“讨好以博取好感”。

definition.en: (plural of curry) Spiced dishes—often a sauce or stew—made with a mix of spices and served with rice, bread, etc.
definition.zh: （curry 的复数）咖喱菜：用多种香料调味的菜肴，常呈酱汁或炖菜状，可配米饭、面饼等。

examples.en: Thai curries often use coconut milk.
examples.zh: 泰式咖喱常用椰奶。

examples.en: We tried two different curries: one mild and one very spicy.
examples.zh: 我们尝了两种不同的咖喱：一种微辣，一种很辣。

definition.en: (third-person singular of curry) To groom a horse by brushing/rubbing its coat.
definition.zh: （curry 的第三人称单数）给马梳理毛发；用刷子/擦拭来清洁马身。

examples.en: She curries the horse every morning before riding.
examples.zh: 她每天早上骑马前都会给马梳理毛发。

definition.en: (third-person singular of curry) To try to gain someone’s favor by flattering them or doing things to please them (often disapproving).
definition.zh: （curry 的第三人称单数）讨好；奉承以博取好感（常含贬义）。

examples.en: He curries favor with the boss by agreeing with everything.
examples.zh: 他对老板百般讨好，对什么都表示赞同。

examples.en: She refuses to curry favor just to get promoted.
examples.zh: 她拒绝为了升职而去讨好别人。

extraExplanation: “curry（咖喱）”在英语里既指菜肴，也可以作动词。动词里最常见的固定搭配是 **curry favor (with someone)**，意思是“讨好/巴结”。
名词“curry”的菜肴含义与南亚饮食文化相关：英语里的 curry 是一个“总称”，并不等同于某一种单独香料；不同国家/地区（印度、泰国、日本、英国等）的“咖喱”风格差异很大。

summary.en: “Currying” most commonly means cooking with curry spices; it can also mean grooming a horse, or (in programming) transforming a multi-argument function into single-argument functions.
summary.zh: “Currying”最常见指用咖喱香料烹调；也可指给马梳理刷洗；在编程中则指把多参数函数变成一连串单参数函数（柯里化）。

definition.en: The act of cooking or seasoning food with curry (a mix of spices) or in a curry-style sauce.
definition.zh: 用咖喱（香料混合物）给食物调味或以咖喱风味烹调的做法。

examples.en: She’s currying chicken with coconut milk and spices.
examples.zh: 她正在用椰奶和香料做咖喱鸡。

examples.en: Currying vegetables is a quick way to add warmth and flavor.
examples.zh: 给蔬菜做咖喱是一种快速增加香气和风味的方法。

definition.en: The act of grooming a horse (or another animal), especially brushing it to clean and improve its coat.
definition.zh: （尤指）为马等动物梳理、刷洗毛皮以清洁并让毛色更光亮的动作。

examples.en: After the ride, he spent time currying the horse.
examples.zh: 骑行后，他花时间给马刷洗梳理。

examples.en: Regular currying helps remove dirt from a horse’s coat.
examples.zh: 经常梳理刷洗有助于清除马身上的污垢。

definition.en: In functional programming, a technique that turns a function that takes multiple arguments into a chain of functions that each take one argument.
definition.zh: （函数式编程）柯里化：把“接收多个参数的函数”改写成“一连串每次只接收一个参数的函数”。

examples.en: Currying lets you create a new function by fixing one argument first.
examples.zh: 柯里化可以先固定一个参数，从而生成一个新函数。

examples.en: In JavaScript, currying is often used to build reusable helpers.
examples.zh: 在 JavaScript 中，柯里化常用来构建可复用的小工具函数。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **curriing** 很可能是拼写错误，常见正确拼写是 **currying**。
“currying（柯里化）”这个编程术语来自数学家 **Haskell Curry** 的名字；而烹饪里的 curry（咖喱）则来自南亚饮食文化相关词源，两者只是拼写相近、含义无关。

summary.en: Likely meant **currajong**: an Australian tree (Brachychiton) often grown as an ornamental and known for drought tolerance.
summary.zh: 你可能想写的是 **currajong**：一种澳大利亚的瓶树属树木，常作观赏树，以耐旱著称。

definition.en: (Australian English) A currajong: an Australian tree (genus *Brachychiton*), often grown as an ornamental; some species have fibrous bark once used for rope.
definition.zh: （澳式英语）瓶树／库拉琼树：澳大利亚的一类树（瓶树属 *Brachychiton*），常作观赏树；某些种类树皮纤维过去可用来制绳。

examples.en: We planted a currajong in the yard because it handles dry weather well.
examples.zh: 我们在院子里种了一棵库拉琼树，因为它很耐旱。

examples.en: The park’s currajongs have thick trunks and bright seed pods in late summer.
examples.zh: 公园里的瓶树树干粗壮，夏末会结出显眼的荚果。

synonyms: bottle tree (common name for some Brachychiton species)
extraExplanation: 你输入的“currijong”通常是拼写误差；更常见的标准拼写是 **currajong**（也写作 *kurrajong*）。
“currajong”一词来自澳大利亚原住民语言（不同地区拼写与读音可能略有差异）。
在澳洲语境里它既可指特定树种，也可更宽泛地指瓶树属（*Brachychiton*）的一些树；日常交流中多在澳大利亚相关话题（植物、园艺、地理）出现。

summary.en: “Curring” is usually a misspelling of “currying,” meaning grooming a horse, cooking with curry spices, or (in “curry favor”) trying to gain approval.
summary.zh: “curring”通常是“currying”的误拼，可指给马刷毛、用咖喱烹饪，或在短语“curry favor”中表示讨好、巴结。

definition.en: (Often written as “currying”) the act of grooming an animal—especially a horse—by rubbing/cleaning its coat with a curry comb or brush.
definition.zh: （常写作“currying”）给动物（尤指马）梳理毛发、用刮刷器/马梳擦洗皮毛的行为。

examples.en: He spent the morning curring the horse before the show.
examples.zh: 演出前，他一早都在给马刷毛。

examples.en: Regular curring helps remove dirt and loose hair.
examples.zh: 经常刷毛能去掉污垢和脱落的毛。

definition.en: (Often written as “currying”) the act of cooking with curry spices, or making a dish into a curry.
definition.zh: （常写作“currying”）用咖喱香料烹饪；把菜做成咖喱的做法。

examples.en: She’s curring vegetables for dinner.
examples.zh: 她正在把蔬菜做成咖喱当晚餐。

examples.en: Try curring the chicken with coconut milk and spices.
examples.zh: 试试用椰奶和香料把鸡肉做成咖喱。

definition.en: In the phrase “curry favor”: trying to gain someone’s approval by flattering or being extra helpful (commonly spelled “currying favor”).
definition.zh: 用于短语“curry favor”：通过拍马屁或刻意讨好来博取好感（更常见拼写为“currying favor”）。

examples.en: He was curring favor with the manager by staying late every night.
examples.zh: 他每天都加班到很晚来讨好经理。

examples.en: Stop curring favor and just do your job well.
examples.zh: 别再拍马屁了，把工作做好就行。

extraExplanation:
“curring”在现代英语里很少作为标准拼写出现，通常是把“currying”（curry 的现在分词）拼错了。你可能想写的是：
1）currying（刷马/做咖喱/讨好：curry favor）；
2）curing（治愈、治病；腌制/风干保存食物）。
如果你告诉我句子语境，我可以帮你确认到底该用哪个词。
动词 curry（刷马）来自中古法语，原义与“给马梳理皮毛”有关；“curry favor”是固定搭配，意思是“讨好、巴结”。

summary.en: “Currish” means rudely insulting or, more rarely, dog-like (old-fashioned).
summary.zh: “Currish”意为粗鲁无礼、出言不逊；较少见的古旧用法是“像狗一样的”。

definition.en: Rude, insulting, and lacking basic respect (often describing speech or behavior).
definition.zh: 粗鲁无礼的；出言不逊的（常形容言语或行为）。

examples.en: The customer made a currish remark to the waiter.
examples.zh: 那位顾客对服务员说了句粗话，非常无礼。

examples.en: She stayed calm even when he became currish.
examples.zh: 即使他变得粗鲁无礼，她仍然保持冷静。

definition.en: Like a dog; dog-like (rare and old-fashioned).
definition.zh: 像狗的；犬类的（较少见、偏古旧用法）。

examples.en: In older writing, “currish” could describe a dog-like snarl.
examples.zh: 在较早的写作中，“currish”可用来形容像狗一样的咆哮。

extraExplanation: “currish”来自“cur”（杂种狗、卑贱的狗；也可用来骂人“卑鄙小人”）。因此它常带有“像狗一样凶、没教养、爱咬人”的联想，语气比较强，现代英语里不算常用，更常见的替换词有 rude、insulting、mean、surly。

summary.en: “Currishly” means “rudely or insultingly, in a mean-spirited way.” It’s rare and literary.
summary.zh: “currishly”意为“粗鲁/侮辱性地、刻薄地”，较少见，偏文学或旧式用法。

definition.en: In a rude, insulting, or ill-mannered way; like a snarling or contemptible person.
definition.zh: 粗鲁无礼地；侮辱性地；像卑劣、爱咆哮的人那样。

examples.en: He spoke currishly to the waiter when his order was late.
examples.zh: 他的餐点上得晚了，他就对服务员粗鲁无礼地说话。

examples.en: The critic dismissed the novel currishly, without giving any real reasons.
examples.zh: 那位评论家带着轻蔑无礼的态度否定了这本小说，却没有给出真正的理由。

extraExplanation: “currishly”来自形容词“currish”（卑劣的、像恶狗一样爱咬人的），而“currish”源于“cur”（杂种狗；也可指卑鄙的人）。因此它常带有“像狗一样咆哮、刻薄”的强烈贬义。
该词在现代英语中很少使用，偏文学/旧式语体。日常表达更常用：rudely, nastily, insultingly, contemptuously。

summary.en: Currishness means mean-spirited, contemptible rudeness or ill-natured behavior.
summary.zh: Currishness 指带恶意的刻薄与卑劣的无礼行为。

definition.en: Rude, ill-natured, or contemptible behavior; the quality of being “currish” (mean-spirited or snarling, like an unfriendly dog).
definition.zh: 卑劣、粗鲁、刻薄的行为；“像恶狗一样”的恶意与无礼的特质。

examples.en: His currishness toward the waiter made everyone at the table uncomfortable.
examples.zh: 他对服务员的刻薄无礼让同桌的人都很不舒服。

examples.en: She answered with unnecessary currishness, as if kindness were a weakness.
examples.zh: 她用一种毫无必要的刻薄口吻回应，仿佛友善是一种软弱。

examples.en: The letter was full of currishness rather than honest criticism.
examples.zh: 这封信充满了恶意的刻薄，而不是真诚的批评。

extraExplanation: “currishness”来自形容词“currish”（粗鄙的、像恶狗一样爱咬人的），而“currish”又与“cur”（常指杂种狗，也引申为卑鄙的人）有关。这个词语气很强、带贬义，多用于书面或较正式的批评场景。
在文学或评论语境里，它常用来形容“带攻击性但缺乏正当理由的刻薄”，比普通的“rudeness（无礼）”更强调“卑劣/恶意”。

summary.en: Currituck is a place name in northeastern North Carolina, especially Currituck County and Currituck Sound.
summary.zh: Currituck 是美国北卡罗来纳州东北部的地名，尤指柯里塔克县与柯里塔克湾/潟湖。

definition.en: a place name in northeastern North Carolina, USA (most commonly referring to Currituck County and the nearby Currituck Sound).
definition.zh: 美国北卡罗来纳州东北部的地名（最常指柯里塔克县 Currituck County，以及附近的柯里塔克湾/潟湖 Currituck Sound）。

examples.en: Currituck County is known for its beaches and wildlife refuges.
examples.zh: 柯里塔克县以海滩和野生动物保护区而闻名。

examples.en: They drove through Currituck on their way to the Outer Banks.
examples.zh: 他们去外滩群岛（Outer Banks）的路上开车经过了柯里塔克。

extraExplanation: “Currituck”是专有名词，写作首字母大写，通常不加冠词（不说 *the Currituck*）。
该地与北卡外滩群岛（Outer Banks）地理与文化联系紧密；“Currituck Sound”中的 sound 指“海湾/潟湖/海峡式水域”，不是“声音”。
词源一般认为与当地美洲原住民语言（多归于阿尔冈昆语系相关语言）有关，可能与“野鹅/鹅群”之类的含义有关；不同资料对细节解释略有差异。

summary.en: Currock is a rare Scots/older word meaning a large wicker basket (creel), and sometimes a rare spelling for a small coracle-like boat.
summary.zh: currock是较少见的苏格兰方言/旧词，常指“大号柳条篮/背篓（creel）”，有时也作为类似coracle的小圆舟的罕见拼写。

definition.en: (Scotland, dialect) A large wicker basket or creel, often used for carrying goods (sometimes carried on the back).
definition.zh: （苏格兰方言）一种大号柳条篮/背篓（类似“背篓、筐”），常用来搬运或装载物品。

examples.en: He slung a currock over his shoulder and walked to the market.
examples.zh: 他把一个currock（背篓）搭在肩上，走去集市。

examples.en: The fisherman packed the catch into a currock lined with leaves.
examples.zh: 渔夫把渔获装进一个垫了树叶的currock里。

definition.en: (Rare, variant spelling) A small, round, lightweight boat made with a frame covered in hide or canvas; similar to a coracle/currach.
definition.zh: （罕见拼写变体）一种小型、圆形、轻便的皮船/篷布船；类似coracle/currach（圆形小舟）。

examples.en: In older writing, “currock” sometimes appears as a spelling for a coracle-like boat.
examples.zh: 在较早的文本里，“currock”有时会被当作类似coracle那种小舟的拼写形式。

examples.en: They crossed the shallow river in a currock.
examples.zh: 他们乘着一只currock渡过了浅河。

extraExplanation: “currock”不是现代标准英语里的常用词，更常见于苏格兰方言或旧文献。遇到它时，建议结合上下文判断：如果谈到装载、搬运、渔获、农具，多半指“柳条背篓/大篮”；如果谈到过河、船只或水上活动，则可能是“coracle/currach（圆形小舟）”的罕见拼写。
相关词：creel（鱼篓/背篓，苏格兰常见）、basket（篮子）；coracle / currach（圆形小舟，常与凯尔特地区文化相关）。

summary.en: “currs” is a very rare plural form of “curr,” meaning low growling sounds (or to growl). Many people actually mean “curs” (plural of “cur”) or an informal abbreviation for “currencies.”
summary.zh: “currs”是非常少见的“curr”的复数，可指低沉的咆哮声（或咆哮）。很多人其实想写“curs”（cur 的复数）或把它当作“货币”的非正式缩写。

definition.en: plural of curr (rare): a harsh growling sound (especially from a dog), or the act of making that sound
definition.zh: （罕见）curr 的复数：指（尤指狗的）低沉粗哑的咆哮声，或发出这种声音的行为

examples.en: In the dark, we heard low currs from behind the fence.
examples.zh: 在黑暗中，我们听到栅栏后面传来低沉的咆哮声。

examples.en: The dog’s warning currs made us step back.
examples.zh: 那只狗警告性的咆哮声让我们后退了。

definition.en: plural of curr (very rare): to make a low, harsh sound; to growl (often said of a dog)
definition.zh: （极罕见）curr 的复数：发出低沉粗哑的声音；咆哮（常指狗）

examples.en: The dogs curr at strangers near the gate.
examples.zh: 那些狗会对靠近大门的陌生人咆哮。

extraExplanation: “currs”在现代英语里非常少见。很多学习者其实想写的是 **curs**（cur 的复数），意思是“坏狗、杂种狗”，也可作侮辱人的说法（较粗鲁）。如果你是想表达“货币（currencies）”的缩写，也有人在聊天或表格里写 **curr.** / **currs** 来代表“currency/currencies”，但这属于非正式用法，最好在正式写作里写全。

summary.en: Curry is a spicy dish or cooking style made with mixed spices, and it can also mean the spice mixture (like curry powder).
summary.zh: Curry 指用混合香料做成的咖喱料理／烹饪风格，也可指咖喱香料混合物（如咖喱粉）。

definition.en: a spicy dish (or style of cooking) made with a mix of spices and often a sauce, common in South Asian and Southeast Asian cuisines
definition.zh: 咖喱（菜肴或烹饪风格）：用多种香料调配，常带酱汁的辛香料理，常见于南亚与东南亚饮食

examples.en: We had chicken curry with rice for dinner.
examples.zh: 我们晚餐吃了咖喱鸡配米饭。

examples.en: This restaurant serves Thai curry and Indian curry.
examples.zh: 这家餐厅提供泰式咖喱和印度咖喱。

definition.en: a mixture of spices used to make curry, especially in the form of curry powder
definition.zh: 咖喱粉／咖喱香料：用来做咖喱的混合香料（常指咖喱粉）

examples.en: Add a teaspoon of curry to the soup.
examples.zh: 在汤里加一茶匙咖喱粉。

examples.en: I ran out of curry powder, so I used cumin and turmeric instead.
examples.zh: 我咖喱粉用完了，所以改用孜然和姜黄代替。

definition.en: to prepare or flavor food with curry or curry spices
definition.zh: 用咖喱调味／做成咖喱口味

examples.en: She curried the vegetables and served them with noodles.
examples.zh: 她把蔬菜做成咖喱口味，然后配面条端上桌。

examples.en: We curry the lentils with garlic and ginger.
examples.zh: 我们用大蒜和姜给扁豆做咖喱调味。

extraExplanation: “Curry”在英语里是一个较宽泛的称呼，并不等于某一种固定配方。不同地区的“咖喱”差异很大：印度常见以多种香料层层叠加；泰式咖喱常用咖喱酱、椰奶；日式咖喱口味更温和、偏甜咸，质地更浓稠。
词源上，“curry”与南亚语言有关；在英语世界中，它常被用来概括多种来自南亚与东南亚的香料炖煮类菜肴，因此在跨文化语境里更适合具体说“Thai green curry / Japanese curry / Indian curry”等。

summary.en: Curry is a spicy (or mild) dish cooked in a seasoned sauce, or the spice mix used to make that flavor; it can also be a verb meaning “to season with curry.”
summary.zh: curry 指咖喱菜/咖喱风味，也可指咖喱粉；作动词表示用咖喱香料或咖喱酱来烹饪或调味。

definition.en: A dish (or style of cooking) in which meat, vegetables, or beans are cooked in a sauce with spices, often served with rice or bread.
definition.zh: 咖喱（菜肴或烹饪风格）：用香料做成的酱汁来炖煮肉、蔬菜或豆类，常配米饭或面饼/面包食用。

examples.en: We had chicken curry with rice for dinner.
examples.zh: 我们晚餐吃了鸡肉咖喱配米饭。

examples.en: Thai curries can be sweet, spicy, and creamy because of coconut milk.
examples.zh: 泰式咖喱常因椰奶而带有甜、辣和浓郁的口感。

examples.en: She learned to make a mild vegetable curry for her family.
examples.zh: 她学会做温和口味的蔬菜咖喱给家人吃。

definition.en: A powdered mixture of spices used to flavor food (often called curry powder).
definition.zh: 咖喱粉：由多种香料混合而成的粉末，用于给食物调味。

examples.en: Add a teaspoon of curry powder to the soup.
examples.zh: 在汤里加一茶匙咖喱粉。

examples.en: This recipe uses turmeric, cumin, and coriander instead of store-bought curry powder.
examples.zh: 这个食谱用姜黄、孜然和香菜籽来代替现成的咖喱粉。

definition.en: To flavor or cook with curry spices or a curry sauce.
definition.zh: 用咖喱（香料/酱汁）调味或烹饪。

examples.en: You can curry the vegetables with onions and coconut milk.
examples.zh: 你可以把蔬菜和洋葱、椰奶一起做成咖喱味。

examples.en: The fish is lightly curried and served with lime.
examples.zh: 这道鱼略带咖喱风味，配青柠一起上桌。

extraExplanation: “curry”在英语里是一个“外来菜名/概念”的典型例子。它并不指某一种固定配方，而是一大类“用香料做酱汁/炖煮”的菜。不同地区的“curry”差异很大：印度常见以多种香料打底；泰国常见红/绿咖喱酱和椰奶；日本咖喱通常更浓稠、偏甜，常配米饭。
词源上，“curry”与南亚语言中表示“酱汁/菜肴”的词有关，后来通过殖民与贸易进入英语，因此在英语文化里也常让人联想到南亚或东南亚饮食。
易混点：英语里“a curry”通常指“一道咖喱菜”；“curry powder”指“咖喱粉”。说“curry”也可泛指“咖喱味/咖喱风格”。

summary.en: A currycomb is a grooming tool used mainly on horses to loosen and remove dirt and loose hair.
summary.zh: currycomb 指主要用于马匹梳理的刮梳器，用来刮松并清除污垢和浮毛。

definition.en: A tool with short teeth (often metal or rubber) used to remove dirt, loose hair, and tangles from a horse’s coat (and sometimes other animals).
definition.zh: （常指马用的）刮梳器；一种带短齿的工具（常为金属或橡胶），用来清理皮毛上的泥土、浮毛与打结。

examples.en: She used a currycomb to loosen the dirt before brushing the horse.
examples.zh: 她先用刮梳器把泥土刮松，再给马刷毛。

examples.en: A rubber currycomb is gentle on sensitive horses.
examples.zh: 橡胶刮梳器对皮肤敏感的马更温和。

extraExplanation: “currycomb”常见于马术与马房护理语境。标准护理流程里，通常先用currycomb打圈按摩并带出污垢与浮毛，再用更细的刷子（如dandy brush/body brush）把毛刷干净。
词源上，“curry”在这里与“咖喱”无关，而与早期表示“梳理/整理马匹”的动词用法相关；因此currycomb就是“梳理马毛用的梳/刮器”。

summary.en: Currycombed means (1) groomed with a currycomb, or (2) figuratively, overly polished/neat, sometimes to the point of seeming artificial.
summary.zh: currycombed 指（1）用刮梳梳理过、刷洗干净的；（2）比喻精心修饰得过于整齐、显得刻意或不自然的。

definition.en: (Of a horse or other animal) groomed with a currycomb; thoroughly brushed and cleaned.
definition.zh: （指马等动物）用刮梳（currycomb）梳理过的；彻底刷洗干净的。

examples.en: The stable hands left the horses currycombed and ready for the show.
examples.zh: 马厩工人把马梳理得干干净净，准备参加展览。

examples.en: After a long ride, he currycombed the mare to remove dust and sweat.
examples.zh: 长途骑行后，他用刮梳把母马身上的灰尘和汗渍清理掉。

definition.en: (Figurative) carefully polished or made neat and orderly; sometimes implying “overly smoothed” or artificial.
definition.zh: （比喻）精心修饰得整整齐齐的；有时含“过度打磨、显得不自然”的意味。

examples.en: His currycombed speech sounded perfect but a little insincere.
examples.zh: 他的发言修饰得很完美，但听起来有点不真诚。

examples.en: The report was currycombed to please the board, with no mention of mistakes.
examples.zh: 这份报告被“梳理”得很漂亮以取悦董事会，完全不提失误。

extraExplanation: “currycomb”是给马梳理毛发、刮除泥土和汗渍的工具；“currycombed”原本是马术/畜牧语境里的“梳理过的”。
比喻义里常带一点批评色彩：像把毛“梳得太顺”一样，指文字、形象或说法被过度修饰、刻意讨好。它和短语“curry favor（巴结、讨好）”在形态上相似，但词源并不完全等同。

summary.en: Currycombing is grooming an animal (especially a horse) with a currycomb; figuratively, it can mean excessive flattery to gain favor.
summary.zh: Currycombing 指用刮马梳给动物（尤指马）刮理被毛；比喻时也可指为了讨好而过度奉承。

definition.en: the act of grooming a horse (or other animals) by rubbing or scraping the coat with a currycomb to remove dirt, loose hair, and dried sweat
definition.zh: 用刮马梳（currycomb）给马（或其他动物）梳理、刮擦被毛的过程，用来去除灰尘、浮毛和干汗渍

examples.en: After the ride, she spent ten minutes currycombing the horse to clean off the dried mud.
examples.zh: 骑完之后，她花了十分钟用刮马梳给马刮理，把干泥清掉。

examples.en: Good stable routine includes brushing, currycombing, and checking for sores.
examples.zh: 良好的马房日常包括刷毛、刮理（currycombing）以及检查是否有擦伤。

definition.en: (figurative, informal) strong flattery or eager attention meant to win someone’s approval; ‘currying favor’
definition.zh: （比喻，非正式）为了博取好感而刻意讨好、拍马屁；即“currying favor（讨好）”

examples.en: The constant currycombing of the boss made the team uncomfortable.
examples.zh: 不断地讨好老板让团队很不舒服。

examples.en: He tried to get the promotion through currycombing instead of good work.
examples.zh: 他想靠讨好而不是靠好好工作来获得升职。

definition.en: to groom an animal with a currycomb; to rub/scrape the coat clean
definition.zh: 用刮马梳给动物刮理被毛；把毛皮刮擦干净

examples.en: They currycombed the horses before the show.
examples.zh: 演出前他们给马做了刮理。

examples.en: If you currycomb gently, you won’t irritate the skin.
examples.zh: 如果你轻柔地刮理，就不会刺激皮肤。

extraExplanation: “currycombing”来自名词“currycomb”（刮马梳）+ 动词化用法。日常语境里更常见的是动词短语“to currycomb a horse”。
比喻义与习语“to curry favor”（讨好、巴结）有关：原本是“梳理马匹”这种‘用力反复刷/刮’的动作，后来引申为‘对人过度殷勤、反复讨好’。
学习提示：写作中如果要表达“拍马屁”，更常用“flattery / sucking up / currying favor”；“currycombing”作比喻时偏少见，但很形象。

summary.en: A currycomb is a horse-grooming tool; to currycomb means to groom a horse with it.
summary.zh: currycomb 指给马梳洗用的马梳/刮刷；作动词表示用它给马梳理。

definition.en: a comb-like tool (often rubber or metal) used to groom a horse by loosening dirt and hair from the coat
definition.zh: （给马梳理用的）马梳/刮刷（常为橡胶或金属材质，用来松开并刮掉被毛上的泥土和浮毛）

examples.en: Before riding, she used a currycomb to remove dried mud from the horse’s coat.
examples.zh: 骑马前，她用马梳把马身上干掉的泥刮下来。

examples.en: The stable keeps currycombs and brushes in every grooming kit.
examples.zh: 马厩里每套清洁工具包都备有马梳和刷子。

definition.en: to groom (a horse) with a currycomb
definition.zh: 用马梳给（马）梳理；刮刷（马匹被毛）

examples.en: He currycombed the horse gently in small circles.
examples.zh: 他轻轻地用马梳打着小圈给马刮刷。

examples.en: After currycombing, you usually brush the coat to lift away the loosened hair.
examples.zh: 用马梳刮刷之后，通常还要再用刷子把松动的毛刷掉。

extraExplanation: “currycomb”多用于马术与马厩日常护理语境：先用currycomb把泥土、皮屑和浮毛“松开”，再用硬毛刷/软毛刷把这些脏东西刷走。
拼写提示：你输入的“currycombs”是复数形式；单数是“currycomb”。
词源上，“curry-”与“梳理、擦刷皮革/马匹”有关；在一些描写马匹护理的经典作品（如《Black Beauty》相关语境）里也常出现类似的梳洗步骤。

summary.en: “Curry favor” means trying to gain approval or advantage through flattery or overly helpful behavior, often insincerely.
summary.zh: “Curry favor”指通过奉承或刻意讨好来博取好感或利益，常带不真诚的含义。

definition.en: to try to gain someone’s approval or advantages by flattering them or acting overly helpful (often in a way that feels insincere)
definition.zh: 通过奉承或过度讨好来博取某人的好感或利益（常带有“不真诚/拍马屁”的意味）

examples.en: He’s always currying favor with the boss by laughing at every joke.
examples.zh: 他总是对老板拍马屁，老板讲什么笑话他都笑。

examples.en: Some politicians curry favor with voters by making promises they can’t keep.
examples.zh: 有些政治人物为了讨好选民，会做出无法兑现的承诺。

examples.en: I don’t want to curry favor; I’d rather earn respect through good work.
examples.zh: 我不想靠讨好换好感；我更愿意用好好工作来赢得尊重。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“curryfavel”很可能是在写 **curry favor**。这个短语常用于批评某人“刻意讨好、拍马屁”。
词源背景：它来自中古英语的讹变。早期有个说法 **curry favel**，其中 **favel** 指“欺骗、奉承”（也与“浅黄褐色的马”有关的典故）。原意类似“给马梳毛以取悦/哄骗”，后来演变成今天的 **curry favor**。
用法提示：多用于描述“对上级/有权势者”的讨好；语气通常偏负面。更中性的表达可以用 **win someone’s favor**（赢得好感）。

summary.en: “Curry favour” means to flatter or please someone (often a person in power) to get a benefit.
summary.zh: “Curry favour”指为了得到好处而奉承、讨好（常指有权势的人）。

definition.en: to try hard to please someone (especially someone powerful) in order to gain an advantage or special treatment
definition.zh: 为了获得好处或特殊待遇而极力讨好（尤指有权势的人）

examples.en: Some employees curry favour with the boss by laughing at all his jokes.
examples.zh: 有些员工会通过对老板的所有笑话都大笑来讨好他。

examples.en: She refused to curry favour with the committee; she wanted her work to speak for itself.
examples.zh: 她拒绝去讨好委员会；她希望用作品本身说话。

extraExplanation: “curry favour”在现代英语里常带贬义，暗示讨好得有些过头、带有功利目的。中性表达可用 “win someone’s favor / gain approval”。
词源上常被解释为来自中世纪法语/传说中的“Favel（或Fauvel）”——一匹象征谄媚与欺骗的马；“to curry Favel”意为给它梳理毛发、讨好它，后来演变为“curry favour”。拼写上英式英语多写 favour，美式多写 favor。
常见搭配：curry favour with sb（讨好某人）。注意不要写成一个词 “curryfavour”，通常分开写。

summary.en: Currying is a programming technique that rewrites a multi-argument function as a chain of one-argument functions, often to make reuse easier.
summary.zh: 柯里化是一种编程技巧：把多参数函数改写成一串一元函数，常用于更方便地复用与组合函数。

definition.en: (in programming) A technique that turns a function that takes multiple arguments into a series of functions that each take one argument.
definition.zh: （编程）柯里化：把一个接收多个参数的函数，转换成一连串每次只接收一个参数的函数的技巧。

examples.en: Currying lets you call a function like add(a, b) as add(a)(b).
examples.zh: 柯里化可以让你把 add(a, b) 这样调用的函数改为 add(a)(b)。

examples.en: With currying, you can create a new function by fixing the first argument.
examples.zh: 通过柯里化，你可以先固定第一个参数，从而生成一个新函数。

definition.en: The act or process of applying currying to a function.
definition.zh: （编程）对函数进行柯里化的过程。

examples.en: We used currying to build smaller reusable functions.
examples.zh: 我们用柯里化来构建更小、可复用的函数。

extraExplanation: “Currying”这个术语来自逻辑学家/数学家 Haskell Curry（哈斯凯尔·柯里）。它在函数式编程里很常见（例如 Haskell、JavaScript 的一些库）。
容易混淆的相关概念是“partial application（部分应用）”：部分应用通常指先填入一部分参数得到新函数；柯里化强调把“多参数函数”结构性地改写成“链式的一元函数”。在实际代码里两者经常一起出现。

summary.en: Curryville is a U.S. place name (a small town/community), found in more than one state.
summary.zh: Curryville 是美国的一个地名（小城镇/社区），在不止一个州都有同名地点。

definition.en: A place name (proper noun). It can refer to small communities in the United States, such as Curryville in Missouri or Curryville in Pennsylvania.
definition.zh: 地名（专有名词）。可指美国的一些小社区，例如密苏里州的 Curryville 或宾夕法尼亚州的 Curryville。

examples.en: She grew up near Curryville, Missouri, and moved to St. Louis for college.
examples.zh: 她在密苏里州的 Curryville 附近长大，后来去圣路易斯上大学。

examples.en: Our GPS found two places named Curryville, so we checked the state before driving.
examples.zh: 我们的导航找到两个叫 Curryville 的地方，所以我们出发前先确认了州名。

extraExplanation: Curryville 属于英语里常见的“地名 + -ville”结构；-ville 源自法语，常表示“城镇/村庄”。在美国，许多地名会重复出现，因此写作或订票时通常要加上州名（例如 Curryville, MO / Curryville, PA）以避免混淆。

summary.en: “Cur” (plural “curs”) is a strong insult for a contemptible person, and it can also mean a mongrel or ill-tempered dog in old-fashioned/literary English.
summary.zh: “cur”（复数“curs”）多作强烈侮辱语，指卑鄙小人；也可作较旧/文学用法，指杂种狗或凶恶的狗。

definition.en: (plural: curs) an insulting word for a mean, dishonest, or contemptible person.
definition.zh: （复数：curs）侮辱性用语：指卑鄙、下流、不可信的人；“卑鄙小人”。

examples.en: Don’t trust him—he’s a miserable cur.
examples.zh: 别相信他——他就是个卑鄙小人。

examples.en: She called the thief a cur and demanded her bag back.
examples.zh: 她骂那个小偷是个卑鄙小人，并要求他把包还回来。

definition.en: (old-fashioned) a mongrel dog, or a dog seen as aggressive or badly behaved.
definition.zh: （较旧用法）杂种狗；或指被认为凶、没教养的狗。

examples.en: A few half-wild curs roamed the streets.
examples.zh: 几条半野的杂种狗在街上游荡。

examples.en: The guard warned us about the farmer’s curs.
examples.zh: 守卫提醒我们小心农夫家的凶狗。

extraExplanation: “cur”是明显带侮辱性的词，用来骂人时语气很重；更中性的说法可以用“jerk”（较口语）、“villain”（更文学/正式）、“scoundrel”（较老派）。
词源上与“狗”有关，所以在文学里常把人比作“cur”来表达轻蔑（如莎士比亚等作品中会出现类似用法）。
你输入的“curs”通常就是“cur”的复数；如果你想问的是缩写（如机构/课程名），需要一点上下文我才能确认。

summary.en: Cursa most commonly refers to the star Beta Eridani; more rarely, it’s a borrowed word meaning a race or route in some local contexts.
summary.zh: Cursa 最常见的含义是恒星“波江座β（Beta Eridani）”；更少见时可作为外来词，表示“比赛”或“路线/行程”等。

definition.en: (Astronomy) The traditional proper name of Beta Eridani, a bright star in the constellation Eridanus.
definition.zh: （天文学）“Cursa”是波江座β（Beta Eridani）的传统专名，位于波江座的一颗较亮恒星。

examples.en: Cursa (Beta Eridani) can be seen near the constellation Orion on some winter evenings.
examples.zh: 在一些冬夜里，Cursa（波江座β）可以在猎户座附近看到。

examples.en: The star Cursa is sometimes identified in older star charts by its traditional name rather than its catalog number.
examples.zh: 在较老的星图中，这颗星有时会用传统名“Cursa”标注，而不是用编号。

definition.en: A less common use in English: a borrowing from languages such as Romanian, meaning a race, run, route, or course (often seen in local contexts rather than standard English).
definition.zh: （英语中较少见）可能借自罗马尼亚语等语言，意为“比赛/赛跑、路线、行程、航线/班次”等，多见于当地语境而非标准英语。

examples.en: In Romanian, cursa can mean “the race” or “the route,” depending on context.
examples.zh: 在罗马尼亚语中，cursa 既可以指“比赛”，也可以指“路线/行程”，取决于语境。

examples.en: Some travel websites keep the word cursa when listing local bus routes.
examples.zh: 一些旅游网站在列出当地公交线路时会保留 cursa 这个词。

extraExplanation: 在天文学里，很多恒星除了“目录编号”（如 Beta Eridani）之外，还有源自阿拉伯语、拉丁语或航海传统的“传统星名”。Cursa 就是其中之一，常用于科普、星图或观星语境。

summary.en: “cursa” is not standard English; it’s usually a typo (often for “curse” or “cursor”) or a borrowed foreign-language form.
summary.zh: “cursa”不是标准英语；多为拼写/打字错误（常见原意为“curse”或“cursor”），或是外语借用形式。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is most often seen as a misspelling or typo (commonly for “curse” or “cursor”), or as a word from another language used in an English text.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词。它最常见于拼写错误/打字错误（常见想写的是“curse（诅咒）”或“cursor（光标）”），或是在英语语境中引用的外语词。

examples.en: I wrote “cursa” by mistake—I meant “curse.”
examples.zh: 我不小心写成了“cursa”，我想写的是“curse（诅咒）”。

examples.en: If you mean the blinking line on the screen, the correct word is “cursor,” not “cursa.”
examples.zh: 如果你指的是屏幕上闪烁的那条线，正确的词是“cursor（光标）”，不是“cursa”。

extraExplanation: “cursa”本身在英语词典里通常查不到。你可以把它放进一句话里（例如：I saw ‘cursa’ on…），我就能判断你到底想表达哪个词。
如果你是在非英语文本里见到“cursa”，它也可能来自罗马尼亚语等语言（例如罗马尼亚语“cursă”可表示“比赛/竞赛、路线/行程”等），但这不属于英语常用词。

summary.en: Cursal means “related to running; adapted for running,” mainly used in scientific contexts.
summary.zh: cursal 指“与奔跑有关的；适于奔跑的”，主要用于科学/动物学语境。

definition.en: Relating to running or adapted for running (used mainly in biology/zoology).
definition.zh: 与奔跑有关的；适于奔跑的（主要用于生物学/动物学语境）。

examples.en: Horses have cursal legs designed for fast running over open ground.
examples.zh: 马的腿属于适于奔跑的类型，适合在开阔地面上快速奔跑。

examples.en: Many cursal animals have long limbs and reduced toes.
examples.zh: 许多善跑动物四肢较长，脚趾数量会减少。

extraExplanation: “cursal”多见于学术写作，日常英语更常用“running”或更常见的同义词“cursorial”。
词源来自拉丁语 *currere*（奔跑），同源词包括“course”（路线/课程）和“current”（流动的；当前的）。
在动物学中，它常用来描述“善跑型”的身体结构（例如长肢、轻量化骨骼、减少脚趾等），以提高奔跑效率。

summary.en: Corsaro: a pirate or (often) a privateer—someone who raids ships, sometimes with official permission.
summary.zh: Corsaro：海盗或（常见于历史语境）私掠者——袭击船只的人，有时带官方许可。

definition.en: A pirate or privateer (a sea raider, often officially authorized to attack enemy ships in wartime).
definition.zh: 海盗；私掠船船员（常指在战争时期得到官方许可、袭击敌国船只的海上掠夺者）。

examples.en: In the novel, the corsaro sails the Mediterranean looking for treasure.
examples.zh: 在小说里，这位“corsaro”航行在地中海寻找宝藏。

examples.en: Some corsaros were privateers who carried legal papers from a government.
examples.zh: 有些“corsaro”是私掠者，携带政府颁发的合法文件。

extraExplanation: “cursaro”更常见的拼写是 corsaro（意大利语/西班牙语）或英语 corsair。它与“pirate（海盗）”接近，但 corsair/corsaro 常带有“私掠者”的历史色彩：在特定战争背景下，可能受雇或受授权攻击敌国商船。
历史上常提到的有地中海与北非沿岸的“巴巴里海盗/私掠者（Barbary corsairs）”，在欧洲文学与航海故事中频繁出现，因此这个词在叙事作品里常带有浪漫冒险或危险传奇的氛围。

summary.en: “Curse” can mean a swear word or the act of swearing, and it can also mean (or describe) a magical/religious “curse” that brings harm or bad luck.
summary.zh: curse 既可指“脏话/咒骂（以及说脏话的行为）”，也可指故事或宗教语境中的“诅咒（带来厄运或伤害）”。

definition.en: A rude or offensive word or phrase; swearing.
definition.zh: 脏话；咒骂的话；骂人的词。

examples.en: Please don’t use curses in class.
examples.zh: 请不要在课堂上说脏话。

examples.en: He muttered a curse under his breath when he dropped his phone.
examples.zh: 他手机掉地上时低声咒骂了一句。

definition.en: A situation believed to bring bad luck or cause harm, often in stories or religion.
definition.zh: （常见于故事或宗教中）诅咒；被认为会带来厄运或伤害的东西。

examples.en: In the fairy tale, the prince lives under a curse.
examples.zh: 在童话里，王子被诅咒所困。

examples.en: Some people thought the old house had a curse.
examples.zh: 有人认为那座老房子带着诅咒。

definition.en: To say rude or angry words; to swear.
definition.zh: 咒骂；说脏话；爆粗口。

examples.en: He started to curse when the computer crashed.
examples.zh: 电脑死机时他开始爆粗口。

definition.en: To call down harm or bad luck on someone; to place a curse on someone (often in myths or formal language).
definition.zh: 诅咒某人；使某人遭受不幸（多见于神话/文学或较正式用法）。

examples.en: The witch cursed the village for breaking her promise.
examples.zh: 女巫因为村民违背承诺而诅咒了整个村庄。

extraExplanation: 语气提示：在日常英语里，curse 作“脏话/咒骂”很常见，但在正式场合通常用更委婉的说法，比如 strong language（粗话）、swear words（脏话）。作“诅咒”时更偏故事、宗教或文学语境。
词源小知识：curse 与“请求降祸”的旧用法有关，后来逐渐扩展到“骂人、说脏话”的现代含义。

summary.en: “Cursed” most often means “under a curse / having very bad luck,” and informally it can mean “damn/annoying.” It’s also the past form of “curse.”
summary.zh: “cursed”最常表示“被诅咒的/倒霉的”；口语里也可表示“该死的/烦人的”以加强语气；它也是“curse”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: Used to describe someone or something affected by a curse (believed bad magic or supernatural harm), or destined to have bad luck.
definition.zh: （因诅咒而）被诅咒的；受邪恶力量影响的；注定倒霉的。

examples.en: The old legend says the treasure is cursed.
examples.zh: 古老的传说说那批宝藏被诅咒了。

examples.en: He felt cursed after losing three jobs in a row.
examples.zh: 他连续丢了三份工作后，觉得自己像是被诅咒了一样。

definition.en: (Informal) Used to express anger or emphasis; similar to “damn.”
definition.zh: （非正式）用于表达愤怒或加强语气；类似“该死的/可恶的”。

examples.en: Where are my cursed keys?
examples.zh: 我那该死的钥匙到底在哪？

examples.en: This cursed computer keeps crashing.
examples.zh: 这台该死的电脑一直死机。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “curse”: to use offensive words at someone, or to call down harm on someone/something.
definition.zh: “curse”的过去式/过去分词：咒骂；诅咒（希望不幸降临于某人/某物）。

examples.en: She cursed under her breath when she missed the train.
examples.zh: 她没赶上火车，低声咒骂了一句。

examples.en: In the story, the witch cursed the prince.
examples.zh: 在故事里，女巫诅咒了王子。

extraExplanation:
“cursed”有两条常见语气线：
1) 童话/神话/恐怖题材里更偏“真的被施了魔法的诅咒”（cursed forest, cursed ring）。
2) 日常口语里常用作“该死的/烦人的”，语气比“annoying”更强，但通常比直接爆粗口更“软”一点（不过在正式场合仍建议避免）。

搭配提示：
- be cursed with + 名词：常表示“（倒霉地）摊上了……”，有时也可用于中性或轻微自嘲（He’s cursed with bad timing. 他总是时机不佳）。
- curse at + 人：对某人咒骂（侧重说脏话/骂人）。
- curse someone/something：诅咒某人/某物（更像故事或夸张说法）。

summary.en: “Curseder” is a nonstandard, joking way to mean “more cursed” (weirder/unsettling), mostly used online.
summary.zh: “curseder”是非标准、带玩笑语气的说法，主要用于网络上，意思是“更邪门/更诡异（more cursed）”。

definition.en: (informal, internet slang) More “cursed”: stranger, unsettling, or wrong in a darkly funny way.
definition.zh: （非正式，网络俚语）更“诡异/邪门”的：怪到让人不舒服、很不对劲，但又带点黑色幽默。

examples.en: That edit is even curseder than the original photo.
examples.zh: 那张P图比原图还更邪门/更诡异。

examples.en: Every time you scroll, the memes get curseder.
examples.zh: 你每往下刷一次，梗图就更邪门了。

definition.en: (rare/nonstandard) A misspelling of “curser” (a person who curses) or a playful form of “cursed.”
definition.zh: （少见/非标准）可能是“curser”（咒骂的人）的拼写错误，或是把“cursed”玩梗式地变形。

examples.en: He’s a constant curser—always swearing at the TV. (Standard: curser)
examples.zh: 他老是骂人——对着电视一直爆粗口。（标准写法：curser）

examples.en: This game is cursed. (More standard than “curseder”)
examples.zh: 这游戏太邪门了。（比“curseder”更标准）

extraExplanation: “curseder”常见于英文网络文化里，属于故意不规范的比较级写法，用来加强“cursed”的梗感（类似把“more cursed”说得更搞笑）。
网络上“cursed (images)”指“看起来非常不对劲、怪异到让人发毛/尴尬”的图片或内容；不一定真的和“诅咒”有关。
在正式写作里建议用“more cursed / even more unsettling / weirder”或直接用“cursed”。

summary.en: “Cursedest” means “the most cursed,” often in poetic/old-fashioned or emphatic speech.
summary.zh: “cursedest”意为“最被诅咒的/最倒霉的”，常带诗歌化、古风或强调语气。

definition.en: (Superlative of *cursed*) most cursed; most accursed or damned (often poetic or old-fashioned).
definition.zh: （*cursed* 的最高级）最被诅咒的；最可憎/最该死的（常见于诗歌或较古旧的用法）。

examples.en: In the story, the hero enters the cursedest part of the forest.
examples.zh: 在故事里，英雄走进了森林中最受诅咒的地方。

examples.en: He called it the cursedest luck he had ever had.
examples.zh: 他称那是自己遇到过最倒霉、最糟的运气。

definition.en: (Informal, emphatic) extremely annoying or troublesome; very bad.
definition.zh: （非正式，用于强调）极其烦人的；糟透的。

examples.en: This is the cursedest printer—it jams every time.
examples.zh: 这台打印机真是烦死人——每次都卡纸。

examples.en: We got caught in the cursedest traffic on the way home.
examples.zh: 回家路上我们遇上了糟透的堵车。

extraExplanation: “cursedest”多见于文学/旧体英语的夸张表达，相当于“the most cursed”。在诗歌或戏剧里，*cursed* 有时写作 *cursèd*（带重音符号è）来提示读者读成两音节 /ˈkɝsɪd/，因此“cursedest”也常读作三音节 /ˈkɝsɪdɪst/。
现代日常英语里通常用“most cursed”而不是“cursedest”；如果用“cursedest”，会带有复古、戏剧化或幽默的语气。

summary.en: “Cursedly” means “as if cursed/unlucky,” or (informal/literary) “extremely; annoyingly.”
summary.zh: “cursedly”表示“倒霉得像被诅咒一样”，也可（较文学/非正式）表示“非常、极其、讨厌地”。

definition.en: In a way that seems cursed or under a curse; as if bad luck is following someone or something.
definition.zh: 以仿佛被诅咒/中了邪的方式；好像一直倒霉、被厄运缠身。

examples.en: Cursedly, the bus broke down again just before the interview.
examples.zh: 倒霉的是，公交车又在面试前坏了。

examples.en: She felt cursedly unlucky all week.
examples.zh: 她觉得自己整整一周都倒霉透了。

definition.en: (Informal or literary) Very; extremely; annoyingly (often to emphasize frustration).
definition.zh: （非正式或文学用法）非常；极其；讨厌地（常用来加强抱怨或恼怒的语气）。

examples.en: The printer is cursedly slow today.
examples.zh: 打印机今天慢得要命。

examples.en: It was cursedly hard to find a taxi in the rain.
examples.zh: 下雨天打车真是难得要命。

extraExplanation: “cursedly”来自形容词“cursed”（被诅咒的/可恶的）加副词后缀“-ly”。在现代英语里它不算常用，更多见于文学描写或带一点“老派/戏剧化”的抱怨语气。日常口语中更常用“really / extremely / annoyingly / damnably”等替代。

summary.en: Cursedness means the state of being cursed, or (informally) a feeling of persistent bad luck.
summary.zh: Cursedness 指“被诅咒的状态”，也可（非正式）指一种持续倒霉的感觉。

definition.en: The state or quality of being cursed (treated as unlucky, doomed, or under a supernatural curse).
definition.zh: 被诅咒的状态或性质（被认为不吉利、注定倒霉，或受到超自然诅咒）。

examples.en: In the legend, the family's cursedness lasted for seven generations.
examples.zh: 在传说中，这个家族的诅咒状态持续了七代。

examples.en: She blamed the cursedness of the house for every strange noise at night.
examples.zh: 她把夜里的每一个怪声都怪在那座房子的“被诅咒”上。

definition.en: (Informal, often humorous) A strong sense of misfortune or bad luck, without implying a real supernatural curse.
definition.zh: （非正式，常带幽默）强烈的倒霉感或“衰运”，不一定真的指超自然诅咒。

examples.en: I swear there's a cursedness to my phone—it's always dying at the worst time.
examples.zh: 我发誓我的手机就是有种“倒霉体质”——总在最糟的时候没电。

examples.en: He joked about the cursedness of his cooking after burning dinner again.
examples.zh: 他晚饭又烧糊了，于是开玩笑说自己的厨艺“自带诅咒”。

extraExplanation: “cursedness”是由形容词“cursed（被诅咒的/该死的）”加名词后缀“-ness”构成，表示“某种性质/状态”。这个词在日常英语里不算高频，更常见的表达有“a curse”“bad luck”“misfortune”。
在网络语境中，“cursedness”常用来形容让人觉得“不对劲、诡异、离谱”的内容（比如“cursed images”），带有戏谑和夸张色彩。

summary.en: “Cursement” is a rare/obsolete word meaning “cursing” or “a curse,” and in modern English it’s usually treated as nonstandard; use “cursing/curse/cursed” instead.
summary.zh: “cursement”是罕见/过时的词，可表示“咒骂/诅咒”或“一个诅咒”，现代英语中多被视为非标准写法；通常用“cursing/curse/cursed”。

definition.en: (Rare/obsolete) The act of cursing; a curse or a cursing utterance.
definition.zh: （罕见/过时）诅咒的行为；诅咒（的话语）；咒骂。

examples.en: In old writings, you may see “cursement” used where modern English would say “cursing.”
examples.zh: 在一些旧文本中，你可能会看到用“cursement”来表达现代英语里的“cursing（咒骂/诅咒）”。

examples.en: He feared the village’s cursement would follow him wherever he went.
examples.zh: 他害怕村里人的诅咒会一路跟着他。

definition.en: (Nonstandard) Often a misspelling or mistaken form in modern English; most writers use “cursing,” “curse,” or “cursed.”
definition.zh: （非标准）在现代英语中常被视为拼写错误或误用；一般改用“cursing”“curse”或“cursed”。

examples.en: If you mean bad language, write “cursing” or “swearing,” not “cursement.”
examples.zh: 如果你指的是说脏话/咒骂，写“cursing”或“swearing”，不要写“cursement”。

extraExplanation:
“cursement”在现代英语里非常少见，更多出现在古旧文本或个别拼写变体中。日常写作建议根据意思选择：
- 表示“诅咒/咒骂（行为）”：cursing
- 表示“一个诅咒（结果/说法）”：a curse
- 表示“被诅咒的/该死的（形容词）”：cursed
- 表示“说脏话”：swearing / using profanity

summary.en: “Cursen” is not standard modern English; you likely mean “curse,” meaning to swear or to wish harm, and also the noun for a swear word or an evil spell.
summary.zh: “cursen”不是现代标准英语常用词；你可能想写的是“curse”，表示说脏话/咒骂或诅咒他人；也可作名词表示脏话或（传说中的）诅咒。

definition.en: to swear; to say rude or offensive words (often using “bad language”)
definition.zh: 咒骂；说脏话（使用粗鲁或冒犯性的语言）

examples.en: Please don’t curse in front of the children.
examples.zh: 请不要在孩子面前说脏话。

examples.en: He cursed under his breath when he dropped his phone.
examples.zh: 他手机掉了的时候小声咒骂了一句。

definition.en: to wish harm or bad luck on someone; to put a “curse” on someone
definition.zh: 诅咒；希望别人遭遇不幸（施加“诅咒”）

examples.en: In old stories, a witch might curse a village.
examples.zh: 在古老的故事里，女巫可能会诅咒一个村庄。

examples.en: She felt like she had been cursed with terrible luck.
examples.zh: 她觉得自己像是被厄运诅咒了。

definition.en: a rude/offensive word or phrase; swear words
definition.zh: 脏话；咒骂的话

examples.en: He shouted a curse when the game ended.
examples.zh: 比赛结束时他喊了一句脏话。

definition.en: a magical or imagined spell that brings bad luck or harm
definition.zh: （魔法/传说中的）诅咒；带来厄运的咒语

examples.en: The legend says the treasure is protected by a curse.
examples.zh: 传说那批宝藏受到诅咒的保护。

examples.en: They tried to break the curse in the final chapter.
examples.zh: 他们在最后一章试图解除诅咒。

extraExplanation: “cursen” 不是现代标准英语里的常见拼写。你可能想写的是 **curse**（动词/名词）或 **cursing**（动名词/现在分词）。
在较旧或文学化的英语中，你可能会看到 **cursed** 写作 **cursèd**（用重音符号表示两音节 /ˈkɝ.sɪd/，常见于诗歌或古典文本），但“cursen”本身很少用。

summary.en: A “curser” is a person who curses or swears.
summary.zh: “curser”指会咒骂或说脏话的人。

definition.en: A person who curses (uses rude, angry, or offensive words).
definition.zh: 咒骂者；爱说脏话/骂人的人。

examples.en: He’s not usually a curser, but he swore when he hit his thumb with the hammer.
examples.zh: 他平时不怎么骂人，但用锤子砸到拇指时就爆了粗口。

examples.en: The coach warned the players not to be cursers during the game.
examples.zh: 教练警告球员比赛时不要骂人。

extraExplanation: “curser”在现代英语里不算常用，更常见的说法是“someone who swears / a person who curses”。
很多学习者会把“curser”与“cursor（光标）”混淆；“cursor”是电脑/手机屏幕上的光标，发音也不同。

summary.en: “Cursers” most commonly means people who curse or swear; rarely (literary) it can mean warhorses.
summary.zh: “cursers”最常指咒骂/说脏话的人；很少见的文学用法中可指战马。

definition.en: People who curse (use offensive language or call for harm to happen).
definition.zh: 咒骂的人；说脏话或诅咒他人的人。

examples.en: The coach warned the players that cursers would be benched.
examples.zh: 教练警告队员：咒骂的人会被按在替补席上。

examples.en: Online cursers often hide behind anonymous accounts.
examples.zh: 网络上的咒骂者常常躲在匿名账号后面。

definition.en: (Rare, literary) Warhorses; swift horses used in battle.
definition.zh: （罕见，文学用法）战马；用于作战的快马。

examples.en: In old tales, knights rode their cursers into battle.
examples.zh: 在古老的故事里，骑士骑着战马奔赴战场。

examples.en: The poem describes “cursers” thundering across the plain.
examples.zh: 这首诗描写战马在平原上雷鸣般奔腾。

extraExplanation: “cursers”通常是“curser”的复数。常见意思来自动词 curse（咒骂、诅咒），指“爱骂人/爱诅咒的人”。
“战马”这个意思较古旧，多见于史诗、骑士文学或圣经式文体；现代英语里更常说 warhorse、steed、charger。

summary.en: “Curses” can mean swear words (rude language) or magical spells of harm; as a verb, it means “swears” or “wishes harm.”
summary.zh: “curses”可指（复数）脏话/咒骂，也可指（复数）诅咒/咒术；作动词时表示“说脏话”或“诅咒（希望坏事发生）”。

definition.en: Offensive or rude words people say when they are angry or frustrated; swear words (plural).
definition.zh: （复数）脏话；咒骂的话（人在生气或沮丧时说的粗鲁词语）。

examples.en: Please don’t use curses in class.
examples.zh: 请不要在课堂上说脏话。

examples.en: He muttered curses under his breath after dropping his phone.
examples.zh: 他手机掉地上后低声嘟囔了几句脏话。

definition.en: Magical spells said to cause bad luck or harm; hexes (plural).
definition.zh: （复数）诅咒；咒术（被认为会带来厄运或伤害的法术）。

examples.en: In the story, the hero must break the curses on the village.
examples.zh: 在故事里，英雄必须解除村庄的诅咒。

examples.en: The old book is said to contain powerful curses.
examples.zh: 那本旧书据说包含强大的诅咒。

definition.en: Says rude or offensive words; swears (third-person singular of “curse”).
definition.zh: （动词第三人称单数）说脏话；咒骂。

examples.en: He curses when he hits his thumb with a hammer.
examples.zh: 他用锤子砸到拇指时就会骂脏话。

examples.en: She rarely curses, even when she’s stressed.
examples.zh: 她即使压力大也很少说脏话。

definition.en: Calls for bad things to happen to someone; wishes harm on someone (third-person singular).
definition.zh: （动词第三人称单数）诅咒某人；希望坏事发生在某人身上。

examples.en: In the legend, the witch curses the prince for his cruelty.
examples.zh: 传说里，女巫因王子的残忍而诅咒他。

examples.en: He curses his own bad luck, not other people.
examples.zh: 他是在抱怨自己的坏运气，并不是诅咒别人。

extraExplanation: 在日常英语里，谈“脏话”更常用 swear words / profanity；curse（作名词）也能指脏话，但语气略更“书面”或更强调“咒骂”。
curse 还常用于文学、神话、奇幻作品里表示“诅咒/咒术”。在现实生活中说“break a curse（解除诅咒）”通常带有故事或比喻色彩。

summary.en: “Curship” is not a standard English word; you probably mean “courtship,” meaning dating/romantic pursuit toward a committed relationship or marriage.
summary.zh: “curship”不是标准英语词；你可能想写“courtship”，指以认真恋爱或结婚为目的的交往/追求过程。

definition.en: (Likely intended: “courtship”) The period or process of dating and getting to know someone with the intention of forming a romantic relationship or marriage.
definition.zh: （你可能想写的是 courtship）指以建立恋爱关系或结婚为目的的交往、追求期。

examples.en: Their courtship lasted two years before they got engaged.
examples.zh: 他们恋爱交往了两年才订婚。

examples.en: In some cultures, courtship follows more formal rules.
examples.zh: 在一些文化中，求爱/恋爱交往有更正式的规则。

examples.en: The movie tells the story of their courtship in the 1990s.
examples.zh: 这部电影讲述了他们在20世纪90年代的恋爱过程。

definition.en: (Less common) Behavior or actions used to attract a romantic partner.
definition.zh: （较不常见）为吸引恋爱对象而表现出的行为、示爱举动。

examples.en: The birds’ courtship includes dancing and singing.
examples.zh: 这些鸟的求偶行为包括跳舞和鸣唱。

examples.en: He tried small gifts as part of his courtship.
examples.zh: 他用送些小礼物来表达追求。

extraExplanation: “curship”不是常见英语单词，最接近且最常见的拼写通常是“courtship”。如果你想表达“恋爱/追求期”，用 courtship 更自然。
courtship 常见于较正式或叙述性语境（比如书籍、电影简介），日常口语里更常说 dating（约会/交往）或 seeing someone（在交往）。

summary.en: Cursillo usually refers to a Catholic weekend retreat/training program; more generally, it can mean a short course (from Spanish).
summary.zh: Cursillo 通常指天主教的周末退省／培训活动；更广义上可指“短期课程”（源自西班牙语）。

definition.en: (In the Catholic Church) a short, intensive spiritual retreat or training course, often held over a weekend, meant to renew faith and encourage Christian leadership.
definition.zh: （天主教语境）“短期密集灵修退省／培训课程”，常为周末举行，旨在更新信仰并鼓励信徒在生活中实践与带领。

examples.en: She went to a Cursillo weekend and said it helped her reconnect with her faith.
examples.zh: 她参加了一个 Cursillo 周末活动，说这帮助她重新与信仰连结。

examples.en: Our parish is hosting a Cursillo for adults next month.
examples.zh: 我们堂区下个月将为成人举办一次 Cursillo。

definition.en: (Less common, from Spanish) a short course or brief training program.
definition.zh: （较少见，源自西语）短期课程；简短的培训项目。

examples.en: He signed up for a cursillo on basic Spanish conversation.
examples.zh: 他报名参加了一个基础西语会话的短期课程。

extraExplanation: “Cursillo”来自西班牙语“cursillo”（字面意思是“短课程”，是“curso 课程”的指小形式）。在英语里常专指天主教的“Cursillo Movement（库西略运动）”所举办的周末退省／培训。
英语写作中常把它当作专有名词使用（首字母大写：Cursillo），并搭配 weekend / movement / retreat 等词。不同地区的发音会受西语影响，但在美式英语中常见读法接近 /kʊrˈsiːjoʊ/。

summary.en: “Cursing” most commonly means swearing (using offensive words). Less commonly, it means putting a magical or religious curse on someone or something.
summary.zh: “cursing”最常指“说脏话/爆粗口”。较少见时也可指“下诅咒/施咒”。

definition.en: The use of rude, offensive, or taboo words (swearing), often to show anger, frustration, or strong emotion.
definition.zh: 咒骂；说脏话（爆粗口），常用来表达愤怒、挫败或强烈情绪。

examples.en: There was a lot of cursing after the team lost the game.
examples.zh: 球队输球后，大家骂声一片。

examples.en: Please avoid cursing in front of children.
examples.zh: 请不要在孩子面前说脏话。

definition.en: Using rude or offensive words; swearing.
definition.zh: 咒骂；说脏话（爆粗口）。

examples.en: He was cursing under his breath when the computer froze again.
examples.zh: 电脑又卡住时，他低声骂了几句。

examples.en: She told him to stop cursing and speak calmly.
examples.zh: 她叫他别骂人，冷静说话。

definition.en: Putting a curse on someone or something; wishing bad luck or harm (less common in everyday modern English).
definition.zh: 下诅咒；诅咒某人或某物（现代日常英语中较少见）。

examples.en: In the story, the witch is cursing the king with eternal sleep.
examples.zh: 在故事里，女巫诅咒国王陷入永眠。

examples.en: The villagers believed the land was cursing anyone who tried to farm it.
examples.zh: 村民相信那片土地会诅咒任何想耕种的人。

extraExplanation: “cursing”常见有两条线：一是日常口语里的“说脏话/爆粗口”（swearing），二是文学/宗教/奇幻语境里的“下诅咒”（a curse）。日常交流中若想更委婉，可用：use strong language（用激烈措辞）、swear（说脏话）、curse words（脏话）。
文化提醒：在美国英语中，公开场合（工作场所、学校、正式会议）cursing通常被视为不礼貌；朋友间可能被当作加强语气，但仍要看关系与场合。影视作品里常用“bleep”把脏话消音。

summary.en: “Cursion” is a rare noun meaning movement or a course/journey, mainly seen in words like excursion, incursion, and recursion.
summary.zh: “cursion”是个罕见名词，表示移动或行进的过程；多见于 excursion、incursion、recursion 等词中。

definition.en: (Rare) A running, movement, or a course of action; a “going” or “journey.” Most learners meet it inside words like excursion and incursion rather than as a standalone word.
definition.zh: （罕见）奔跑、移动或行动的过程；“行进/旅程”。学习者通常在 excursion（短途旅行）和 incursion（入侵）等词里见到它，而不是单独使用。

examples.en: In modern English, you usually see -cursion in words like excursion and incursion.
examples.zh: 在现代英语中，你通常在 excursion、incursion 这类词里看到 -cursion。

examples.en: An excursion is a short trip for pleasure or learning.
examples.zh: excursion 指为了娱乐或学习而进行的短途旅行。

examples.en: An incursion is a sudden entry into a place, often by force.
examples.zh: incursion 指突然进入某地，常带有武力或侵犯的意味。

extraExplanation:
“cursion”源自拉丁语 cursio（奔跑、行进），与动词 currere（跑）同源。英语里它几乎不单独使用，更常作为词根/后缀出现在：
- ex-（向外）+ -cursion → excursion（外出短途旅行）
- in-（向内）+ -cursion → incursion（闯入/入侵）
- re-（再）+ -cursion → recursion（递归；反复返回）
理解前缀（ex-, in-, re-）+ “行进/进入”的核心含义，会更容易记这些词。

summary.en: “Curiosity” means a desire to know or learn, and it can also mean an interesting, unusual object.
summary.zh: “Curiosity”指“好奇心；求知欲”，也可指“稀奇有趣的事物/奇珍”。

definition.en: a strong desire to know, learn, or understand something; interest in discovering new information
definition.zh: 好奇心；想了解、学习或弄明白某事的强烈欲望

examples.en: Her curiosity led her to ask many questions in class.
examples.zh: 她的好奇心让她在课堂上问了很多问题。

examples.en: I opened the old box out of curiosity.
examples.zh: 我出于好奇打开了那个旧盒子。

definition.en: something unusual, rare, or interesting that people want to look at or learn about
definition.zh: 稀奇事物；奇特或罕见的东西（引人观看或了解）

examples.en: The museum has a room of curiosities from the 1800s.
examples.zh: 那家博物馆有一间展出19世纪奇珍异物的房间。

examples.en: The tiny book was a curiosity that visitors loved to see.
examples.zh: 那本小小的书是一件让游客爱看的稀奇物。

extraExplanation: “cursitate” 不是常见英语单词，最可能是拼写错误，常见目标词是 **curiosity**。如果你想查的是别的词（例如 *curate* / *cursory* / *curious*），告诉我你的句子或语境，我可以帮你确认。
词源提示：**curiosity** 来自拉丁语 *cura*（关心、照料），所以它既有“关心并想弄清楚”的感觉，也可能带一点“爱打听”的意味。

summary.en: Cursitor is an archaic noun: mainly a historical Chancery clerk in England, and more broadly an old word for a runner or messenger.
summary.zh: Cursitor 是一个古旧名词：主要指英国衡平法院的旧式书记官（办理/签发某些令状），也可泛指奔走传信的信使。

definition.en: (historical, Britain) A clerk in the English Court of Chancery who prepared and issued certain legal writs (documents).
definition.zh: （历史用语，英国）英国衡平法院（Chancery）的一种书记官，负责起草并签发某些令状（法律文书）。

examples.en: In older legal records, a cursitor is listed among the officers of Chancery.
examples.zh: 在较早的法律档案中，cursitor 常被列为衡平法院的官员之一。

examples.en: The document was issued through a cursitor rather than a modern court clerk.
examples.zh: 这份文书是经由 cursitor 签发的，而不是通过现代意义上的法院书记员。

definition.en: (archaic) A runner or messenger; someone who carries messages quickly.
definition.zh: （古义）奔走传信的人；信使。

examples.en: A cursitor was sent ahead to announce the arrival of the party.
examples.zh: 一名 cursitor 被派去提前通报队伍将到。

examples.en: In medieval-style writing, the cursitor serves as a fast messenger between courts.
examples.zh: 在仿中世纪风格的写作里，cursitor 往往充当往返各个宫廷的快速信使。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常罕见，主要出现在英国旧式法律/历史语境中。与现代常见词不同，它更像一个“官职名称”。
词源上与拉丁语 cursor（奔跑者）有关，因此既能指“奔走的人”，也曾专指英国衡平法院中负责特定文书流程的官员。读到时可先用“旧时法院书记官/令状办理官”来理解。

summary.en: Cursive refers to a flowing style of handwriting where letters are connected; it can also describe fonts that imitate that style.
summary.zh: cursive 指草写体/连笔手写体（字母连写、笔画流畅），也可形容模仿这种风格的字体。

definition.en: Written in a flowing, connected style of handwriting where many letters join together.
definition.zh: （书写）草写体；连笔书写的手写体，许多字母会连在一起。

examples.en: My grandmother still writes letters in cursive.
examples.zh: 我奶奶现在写信仍然用草写体（连笔字）。

examples.en: Some schools teach cursive in third grade.
examples.zh: 一些学校在三年级教草写体。

examples.en: I can read cursive, but I don’t write it often.
examples.zh: 我能读草写体，但不常这样写。

definition.en: Cursive handwriting as a style (the system of writing).
definition.zh: 草写体（作为一种书写体系/字体风格）。

examples.en: Her cursive is neat and easy to read.
examples.zh: 她的草写体很工整，也很容易读。

examples.en: The signature is in cursive.
examples.zh: 这个签名是用草写体写的。

definition.en: A handwritten style or font that imitates connected handwriting.
definition.zh: （字体/排版）模仿连笔手写的花体/手写体字体。

examples.en: They printed the invitations in a cursive font.
examples.zh: 他们用花体（连笔手写风格）的字体印了请柬。

examples.en: Cursive lettering can look elegant on a logo.
examples.zh: 连笔花体字用在标志上会显得很优雅。

extraExplanation: “cursive”来自拉丁语词根，和“running（流动、奔跑）”的概念有关，所以它强调笔画连贯、书写速度快。
在美国语境里，cursive 常用于“草写体/连笔字”，与“print / block letters（分开写的印刷体/正楷）”相对。许多历史文件、老式书信和签名都常见 cursive。

summary.en: “Cursively” means “in cursive handwriting,” with connected letters.
summary.zh: “cursively”表示“用草写体/连笔字地”。

definition.en: In cursive handwriting (with connected, flowing letters).
definition.zh: 用草写体（连笔、流畅的手写体）地。

examples.en: Please write your full name cursively on the form.
examples.zh: 请在表格上用草写体（连笔）写下你的全名。

examples.en: She signed her name cursively at the bottom of the letter.
examples.zh: 她在信的末尾用连笔草写签了名。

examples.en: The heading was written cursively, but the rest was in print.
examples.zh: 标题是用草写体写的，但其余部分是用印刷体（分开写的字母）写的。

extraExplanation: “cursively”来自“cursive”（草写体、连笔字）。在美国日常表达中，人们更常说“in cursive”而不是“cursively”，例如：Write it in cursive.
“cursive”通常指字母相连的手写方式，和“print”（不连笔、像印刷字体那样分开的手写）相对。学校里有时会教两种写法，因此在表格、签名等语境里很常见。

summary.en: Cursiveness means the quality of being cursive—especially connected, flowing handwriting—and sometimes a general sense of flow or continuity in style.
summary.zh: cursiveness 指“连笔/草写体”的特性，尤指书写中笔画相连、流畅的程度；有时也泛指风格或表达的流畅连贯性。

definition.en: The quality or state of being written in cursive (connected, flowing handwriting).
definition.zh: （书写）草写体/连笔字的特性；连笔书写的状态。

examples.en: The teacher praised the neatness and cursiveness of her handwriting.
examples.zh: 老师表扬了她字迹的整洁和连笔书写的流畅感。

examples.en: His signature has a lot of cursiveness, so it’s hard to read.
examples.zh: 他的签名连笔很多，所以不太好辨认。

definition.en: A flowing, continuous quality in style or movement (often used in formal or academic writing).
definition.zh: （风格或动作的）流畅连贯性（多用于较正式或学术语境）。

examples.en: The poem’s cursiveness makes the lines feel like one long breath.
examples.zh: 这首诗的连贯流畅感让每一行像一口长长的呼吸。

examples.en: Her speech had a calm cursiveness that kept the audience engaged.
examples.zh: 她的演讲有一种平静的流畅感，让听众一直投入。

extraExplanation: “cursiveness”来自形容词“cursive”（连笔的、草写体的）。日常更常说“cursive handwriting”（连笔字/草写体）或“write in cursive”（用连笔写），而“cursiveness”本身偏书面、评价性质（强调“连笔程度/流畅感”）。
在美国教育语境里，是否学习cursive因州、学区和年代不同而差异很大；因此有人会把“cursiveness”与“legibility”（易读性）一起讨论：连笔多不一定更好读。

summary.en: Cursive is a flowing handwriting style with joined letters; “cursives” is the plural, meaning multiple cursive styles or cursive letters.
summary.zh: cursive 指连笔、流畅的手写体；cursives 是其复数，可指多种连笔书写体或用连笔写出的字母/文字。

definition.en: (usually: cursive writing) A style of handwriting in which letters are joined together with flowing strokes.
definition.zh: （常指：连笔书写）一种手写体风格，字母之间常连写，笔画流畅。

examples.en: In elementary school, we practiced cursive every Friday.
examples.zh: 小学时，我们每周五练习连笔字。

examples.en: Her cursive is so neat that it looks like a font.
examples.zh: 她的连笔字很工整，看起来像字体。

definition.en: Written in a joined, flowing handwriting style (not printed block letters).
definition.zh: 用连笔、流畅的手写体书写的（不是印刷体/正楷）。

examples.en: Please write your signature in cursive.
examples.zh: 请用连笔签名。

examples.en: The note was in cursive, so it was hard for me to read.
examples.zh: 那张便条是连笔字，所以我读起来很困难。

definition.en: (plural: cursives) Different cursive scripts/handwriting styles, or letters written in cursive.
definition.zh: （复数：cursives）不同的连笔书写体/连笔字风格，或用连笔写出的字母/文字。

examples.en: The exhibit compares cursives from different time periods.
examples.zh: 这个展览比较了不同时期的连笔书写体。

examples.en: Some cursives are easier to read than others.
examples.zh: 有些连笔字比另一些更容易读。

extraExplanation: “cursives”是“cursive”的复数形式，但日常英语里更常说“cursive writing”（连笔书写）或直接说“cursive”。例如：I can’t read cursive.（我看不懂连笔字。）
在美国语境中，“learn cursive”常指在小学学习连笔字；而“print”通常指不连写的“正楷/印刷体”写法。
在排版/字体里也会看到“cursive font”（手写风格字体），但它不一定真的模仿每一种手写连笔规则。

summary.en: “Curson” is usually a surname; many learners may mean “cursor” (the on-screen pointer).
summary.zh: “Curson”通常是姓氏；很多学习者可能想写的是“cursor”（屏幕上的光标/指针）。

definition.en: A family name (surname).
definition.zh: 姓氏（家族名）。

examples.en: Ms. Curson will join the meeting at 3 p.m.
examples.zh: Curson 女士将于下午三点参加会议。

examples.en: I saw a book by Curson in the library catalog.
examples.zh: 我在图书馆目录里看到一本作者是 Curson 的书。

definition.en: A likely misspelling of “cursor,” the moving marker on a screen that shows where text will appear or what you are pointing at.
definition.zh: 可能是 “cursor” 的拼写错误：屏幕上会移动的光标/指针，用来显示文字将出现的位置或你指向的对象。

examples.en: Move the cursor to the top of the page.
examples.zh: 把光标移到页面顶部。

examples.en: The cursor is blinking in the text box.
examples.zh: 光标正在文本框里闪烁。

extraExplanation: “Curson”并不是一个常见的英语词汇；更常见的是人名/姓氏。
如果你想表达电脑上的“光标”，标准拼写是 cursor（不是 curson）。在日常学习和办公场景里，cursor 的使用频率很高。

summary.en: A cursor is a movable on-screen pointer or a blinking mark that shows where actions or typing will happen.
summary.zh: cursor 指电脑上的指针或文档中闪烁的插入点，用来表示点击或输入将发生的位置。

definition.en: A movable symbol on a computer screen (often an arrow) that shows where you are pointing; it moves when you move a mouse or trackpad.
definition.zh: （电脑屏幕上的）光标/鼠标指针；通常是箭头形，随着鼠标或触控板移动，用来表示你指向的位置。

examples.en: Move the cursor over the link and click it.
examples.zh: 把光标移动到链接上，然后点击。

examples.en: My cursor disappeared, so I restarted the app.
examples.zh: 我的光标不见了，所以我重启了应用。

definition.en: A blinking mark in a document that shows where the next character will appear (also called an insertion point or text cursor).
definition.zh: （文档中的）插入点/文本光标；通常会闪烁，表示下一个字符将出现的位置。

examples.en: Place the cursor at the end of the sentence and press Enter.
examples.zh: 把光标放到句子末尾，然后按回车。

examples.en: Use the arrow keys to move the cursor left or right.
examples.zh: 用方向键把光标向左或向右移动。

definition.en: In computing (especially databases/programming), a control or pointer used to step through items or records one by one.
definition.zh: （计算机/数据库/编程中）游标；用于逐条遍历数据项或记录的控制指针。

examples.en: The program uses a cursor to fetch each row from the database.
examples.zh: 程序使用游标从数据库中逐行取出数据。

extraExplanation: “cursor”源自拉丁语，原意与“奔跑者/跑动的人”相关，所以它在电脑里也有“在屏幕上移动的标记”的感觉。日常使用中，“mouse pointer（鼠标指针）”更强调跟随鼠标移动的箭头；“text cursor / insertion point（文本光标/插入点）”更强调打字位置。

summary.en: Cursory means quick and not thorough—done with only minimal attention.
summary.zh: cursory 表示“匆匆的、不够仔细的、粗略的”。

definition.en: Quick and not careful; done with only a small amount of attention.
definition.zh: 草率的；粗略的；匆匆的（没有仔细查看或深入思考）。

examples.en: I only had time for a cursory glance at the report.
examples.zh: 我只来得及粗略地看了一眼那份报告。

examples.en: The doctor did a cursory check and told her to rest.
examples.zh: 医生做了个简单检查，就让她休息。

examples.en: A cursory search didn’t find the missing key.
examples.zh: 粗略地找了一遍也没找到丢失的钥匙。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“cursorary”常见于把 **cursory**（粗略的）拼错。注意不要和 **cursor**（光标/游标）混淆：**cursory** 来自拉丁语词根，含义更接近“匆匆掠过（视线）”，而不是“光标”。
常见搭配：**a cursory glance/look/check/review**（粗略一看/检查/审阅）。在正式写作里，cursory 往往带有“做得不够仔细”的暗示。

summary.en: A cursor is the on-screen pointer or indicator that shows where actions or typing will happen; in computing, it can also mean a marker used to move through data.
summary.zh: cursor 指屏幕上的光标/指针，表示操作或输入的位置；在计算机领域也可指用于遍历数据的“游标”。

definition.en: A moving symbol on a computer screen that shows where you are working (for example, where the next click or typed character will go).
definition.zh: （电脑屏幕上的）光标/指针，表示你正在操作的位置（例如下一次点击或输入会发生的地方）。

examples.en: Move the cursor to the top of the page and click “Save.”
examples.zh: 把光标移到页面顶部，然后点击“保存”。

examples.en: My cursor froze, so I restarted the computer.
examples.zh: 我的光标卡住了，所以我重启了电脑。

definition.en: In programming or databases, a tool/marker used to step through rows of data one by one.
definition.zh: （编程/数据库）游标，用来逐行遍历数据的标记/工具。

examples.en: The program uses a cursor to read each record in the table.
examples.zh: 这个程序使用游标逐条读取表中的记录。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“Cursores”更像是西班牙语/葡萄牙语里对英语“cursors（cursor 的复数）”的写法。在英语里常用形式是 cursor（单数）/ cursors（复数）。
容易混淆的词：cursor（鼠标指针/屏幕上的指示符）和 caret（插入点，通常是一条闪烁的竖线，表示下一次输入的位置）。很多人日常会把两者都叫“cursor”。
词源小知识：cursor 来自拉丁语，和“run（跑）”有关，原意是“奔跑者/信使”，后来引申为“在文本/屏幕上移动的指示符”。

summary.en: A cursor is the on-screen marker (pointer or blinking line) that shows where you are clicking or typing.
summary.zh: cursor 指屏幕上的指示标记（指针或闪烁的输入光标），用来显示你将点击或输入的位置。

definition.en: A moving marker on a screen that shows where the next action will happen (for example, where text will be typed or what you will click).
definition.zh: （电脑/手机屏幕上的）光标；指针，显示下一步输入或操作的位置。

examples.en: Move the cursor to the end of the sentence and press Enter.
examples.zh: 把光标移到句末，然后按回车键。

examples.en: My cursor disappeared, so I restarted the app.
examples.zh: 我的光标不见了，所以我重启了应用。

definition.en: A small blinking line (in a text box) showing where the next letter will appear; also called an insertion point.
definition.zh: （文本框里闪烁的）插入点；输入光标，表示下一次输入字符的位置。

examples.en: Click inside the box to place the cursor.
examples.zh: 点击框内以放置光标。

examples.en: The cursor is blinking after the last word.
examples.zh: 光标在最后一个词后闪烁。

definition.en: In older contexts, a person or symbol used to point to or highlight something (rare in modern English).
definition.zh: （较旧或较少见用法）指示者；用于指向或强调内容的人/符号。

examples.en: In early manuscripts, a cursor sometimes guided the reader’s attention.
examples.zh: 在早期手稿中，有时会用指示符号引导读者注意力。

extraExplanation: “cursor”来自拉丁语 *currere*（意为“跑、移动”），所以它的核心概念是“在页面/屏幕上移动的指示标记”。
你输入的“cursores”常见于西班牙语/葡萄牙语中，意思是“光标（复数）”。英语复数是 **cursors**。
相关词：**mouse pointer**（鼠标指针/箭头）、**caret**（插入符号 ^，也常用来指“插入光标”）、**highlight**（高亮/选中）。

summary.en: Cursoria is a less common scientific term referring to “running” birds, and it can also describe animals adapted for running on land.
summary.zh: Cursoria 是一个较不常见的科学术语，可指“善于奔跑”的鸟类（旧式分类），也可作描述词表示“适于陆地奔跑的”。

definition.en: (Zoology, taxonomy) A former/less common scientific grouping name used for certain “running” birds—birds adapted for moving on the ground rather than perching or swimming. (In modern classification, these birds are usually placed in different groups.)
definition.zh: （动物学/分类学）一种较旧或不常用的分类名称，用来指一些“善于奔跑”的鸟类——主要适应在地面行走或奔跑，而不是栖息或游泳。（现代分类中通常已分到其他类群。）

examples.en: In older books, some ground-running birds were discussed under the name Cursoria.
examples.zh: 在一些较早的书里，一些善于在地面奔跑的鸟类会被放在 Cursoria 这个名称下讨论。

examples.en: The term Cursoria is less common in modern bird classification.
examples.zh: 在现代鸟类分类中，Cursoria 这个术语不太常见。

definition.en: (Zoology, descriptive) Relating to running; adapted for running on land (similar in meaning to “cursorial”).
definition.zh: （动物学，描述用）与奔跑有关的；适于在陆地上奔跑的（意义接近 cursorial）。

examples.en: Ostriches have cursoria(l) features such as long, strong legs.
examples.zh: 鸵鸟有“善跑型”的特征，比如长而有力的腿。

examples.en: Some animals show cursoria adaptations for life on open plains.
examples.zh: 有些动物表现出适应开阔平原生活的“善跑型”适应特征。

extraExplanation: 词源上与拉丁语 currere（“跑”）有关，因此它常出现在动物学/比较解剖学里，用来强调“以奔跑为主要运动方式”的形态与生活方式。
如果你是在读鸟类学资料：现代分类更常用具体的“目/科”名称，而不是 Cursoria 这种较旧的集合性名称；不同书籍的用法可能不一致。

summary.en: Cursoria is a rare scientific term (mostly historical) referring to a group of ground-running birds.
summary.zh: Cursoria 是较少见的科学术语（多为历史用法），指一类善于在地面奔跑的鸟类。

definition.en: a scientific (often older) taxonomic name used for certain “running” birds (ground-running birds), rather than perching or swimming birds; not common in everyday English
definition.zh: （科学用语，常见于较旧的分类体系）指某些“善于奔跑的鸟类”的分类名称；日常英语中很少使用

examples.en: In some older textbooks, birds like ostriches were discussed under groups such as Cursoria.
examples.zh: 在一些较旧的教材里，像鸵鸟这样的鸟类会被放在诸如 Cursoria 之类的类别中讨论。

examples.en: The term Cursoria is mostly historical and you may not see it in modern bird classification.
examples.zh: Cursoria 这个术语多为历史用法，在现代鸟类分类中你可能看不到。

synonyms: ratites (modern/common group name in many contexts)
extraExplanation: 词源上与拉丁语“currere（奔跑）”有关，同源词包括：cursor（光标/跑者），cursorial（善于奔跑的；适于奔跑的，常用于动物学）。
如果你本来想查的是更常见的英文单词“cursorial”（形容词），拼写可能是 cursorial 而不是 cursoria。

summary.en: Cursorial means “adapted for running,” especially used to describe animals built for fast movement on land.
summary.zh: Cursorial 意为“适于奔跑的”，多用于描述为陆地快速移动而进化的动物。

definition.en: (Of an animal) adapted for running; built for speed on land.
definition.zh: （指动物）适于奔跑的；为陆地快速奔跑而进化的。

examples.en: Horses are cursorial animals with long legs built for speed.
examples.zh: 马是典型的奔跑型动物，长腿有利于速度。

examples.en: Many cursorial predators rely on endurance to catch prey.
examples.zh: 许多奔跑型捕食者依靠耐力来追捕猎物。

definition.en: (Technical) Relating to running or rapid movement.
definition.zh: （较专业）与奔跑或快速移动有关的。

examples.en: Researchers compared cursorial locomotion in wolves and dogs.
examples.zh: 研究人员比较了狼和狗的奔跑式运动方式。

extraExplanation: “cursorial”常见于生物学、人类学和动物行为学语境，用来描述一种体型与运动方式：四肢相对较长、身体更适合在地面快速前进。它的词根来自拉丁语 *cursor*（奔跑者）。
相关对比词有：*arboreal*（树栖的）、*aquatic*（水生的）、*fossorial*（掘洞/穴居的）。在科普或论文里，这类词常用来快速概括动物的生态位与形态特征。

summary.en: Cursoriidae is the scientific bird-family name for coursers and pratincoles.
summary.zh: Cursoriidae 是鸟类的一个科名（学名），包括走鸻和燕鸻。

definition.en: a biological family of birds that includes the coursers and pratincoles (ground-dwelling, long-legged birds found mainly in open, dry habitats).
definition.zh: （鸟类分类）鸻形目中的一个鸟科：鸻鹬科（Cursoriidae），包括走鸻（coursers）与燕鸻（pratincoles）；多栖息于开阔、干旱或半干旱环境，善于在地面奔走。

examples.en: The cream-colored courser belongs to the family Cursoriidae.
examples.zh: 淡色走鸻属于鸻鹬科（Cursoriidae）。

examples.en: Some Cursoriidae species hunt insects by running quickly across open ground.
examples.zh: 鸻鹬科（Cursoriidae）的一些物种会在开阔地面快速奔跑来捕食昆虫。

extraExplanation: “Cursoriidae”是拉丁化的学名，用于生物分类学；在写作中常见于科普、观鸟记录、动物志等正式语境。
词根提示：与拉丁语“cursor”（奔跑者）相关，呼应该类鸟擅长在地面快速奔跑的特征。
相关常见英文：courser（走鸻，常见于干旱地带）、pratincole（燕鸻，常在水边或草地上空捕虫）。

summary.en: Cursoriidae is a scientific family name for certain ground-running birds, especially coursers.
summary.zh: Cursoriidae 是鸟类学中的一个科名，主要指地面奔跑取食的走鹬类鸟。

definition.en: a scientific family name for certain ground-dwelling birds, especially the coursers (in some classifications, also related to pratincoles).
definition.zh: （生物分类）鸟类的一个科名，主要指走鹬（coursers）等地栖鸟；在某些旧的分类中也与燕鸻（pratincoles）有较近关系。

examples.en: In some older sources, Cursoriidae is used as the family name for coursers.
examples.zh: 在一些较早的资料中，Cursoriidae 被用作走鹬类的科名。

examples.en: The paper discusses how Cursoriidae has been reclassified in modern taxonomy.
examples.zh: 这篇论文讨论了 Cursoriidae 在现代分类学中如何被重新划分。

extraExplanation: Cursoriidae 是拉丁化的科学名称，常见于动物学/鸟类学文献中。现代分类里，许多资料把“走鹬（coursers）”放在走鹬科（Cursoriidae），而“燕鸻（pratincoles）”通常归入燕鸻科（Glareolidae）。因此你在不同年代或不同数据库里可能会看到不同的处理方式。
词根提示：cursor 在拉丁语中有“奔跑者”的意思，对应这些鸟在地面快速奔跑、追捕昆虫等小型猎物的行为特征。

summary.en: “Cursorily” means quickly and without careful attention to details.
summary.zh: “cursorily”表示快速且不仔细地、粗略地（常含不够认真之意）。

definition.en: In a quick and not detailed way; superficially.
definition.zh: 草草地；粗略地；不深入地。

examples.en: I only cursorily read the article before class.
examples.zh: 上课前我只是粗略地读了一下那篇文章。

examples.en: The inspector cursorily checked the documents and missed the error.
examples.zh: 检查员草草看了文件，结果漏掉了错误。

examples.en: She gave the room a cursorily glance and walked on.
examples.zh: 她粗略扫了一眼房间就继续往前走了。

extraExplanation: “cursorily”来自形容词“cursory”（粗略的、草率的），词根与拉丁语“currere”（跑）有关，带有“匆匆掠过、像跑过一样快速”的感觉。
学习提示：它通常带有“因为太快所以不够认真/不够全面”的语气；若只是中性表达“简要地”，也可用“briefly”。

summary.en: Cursoriness means the quality of being quick and not thorough.
summary.zh: cursoriness 指“草率、粗略”的状态，即做得快但不够仔细。

definition.en: The quality of being cursory: done quickly and without careful attention to details.
definition.zh: 草率；粗略：做事很快、没有认真关注细节的状态或特质。

examples.en: The report suffered from cursoriness and missed several key facts.
examples.zh: 这份报告因过于草率而漏掉了几个关键事实。

examples.en: A quick, cursory check can be useful, but too much cursoriness may cause mistakes.
examples.zh: 快速粗略的检查有时有用，但过度草率可能导致错误。

extraExplanation: “cursoriness”来自形容词“cursory”（草率的、粗略的）。词根与拉丁语 currere（跑）有关，原意带有“匆匆掠过”的感觉。
常见搭配：cursoriness in (one’s) work / review / inspection（在工作/审阅/检查中的草率）。
学习提醒：不要把“cursory（粗略的）”和“coarse（粗糙的、粗俗的）”混淆；前者强调“不仔细”，后者强调“质地/表达粗糙或粗鲁”。

summary.en: “Cursorious” is not standard English; it’s most likely a misspelling of “curious,” meaning “interested in learning” or sometimes “strange.”
summary.zh: “cursorious”不是标准英语；多半是把“curious”拼错了，意思是“好奇的”，有时也可表示“奇怪的”。
